Reviews.Title: “Good value, but not Executive!”
Reviews.Author: Jane861
Reviews.Content: These apartments were value for money as by booking in advance we got a very good rate. The first room we were given had no window to speak of and was very dungeon like. We explained to the staff that we were claustrophobic and so they showed us another room upstairs with a window which we gladly took. The male staff member was a little patriotic at first but warmed up a little shortly afterwards. Great for location and cleanliness, but not executive and very warm in the corridors!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, tidy - perfect for short stay”
Reviews.Author: Rydav
Reviews.Content: Finding the apartment wasnt really much of a problem, straight off the tube at Bayswater onto the road of the apartment. However, wasnt sure where apartment entrance was on road, but phoned and receptionist came and found us. Good service! Given apartment 18a on basement, very clean and tidy, quite small but perfect for just a 1 night stay where we were out in London 95% of the time. No complaints at all, good value for money, will definately go again. Went with a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Average Place”
Reviews.Author: Ste1989
Reviews.Content: With a name like Executive Apartments i was hoping for a little more then what was there. basically it was a bedroom no bigger then what i have at home with a ''kitchen'' fitted into it. The location is minuites from tube stations and Parks so for location cannot fault it, but for what you recieve for your money its very little. I would stay here again however if i travelled to london as location is great, very quiet and staff help you out with any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed one night, it was great”
Reviews.Author: JETHampshire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in one of the apartments, located in the basement, it was great. Very quiet, comfortable bed in fact a second double so could be used as a family room or by another couple. Room very well appointed, shower was brilliant, nice toiletries plenty of soft white towels. Room had a breakfast bar and excellent china and cutlery and an efficient fridge and microwave. Location is excellent as others have said, a step from Queensway and the buses into the centre of town. On the edge of Hyde Park, perfect. Price was great, particularly for a room in the centre of London offering what we had. Will definitely use it again, would recommend. Reception staff very helpful no problems here.

Reviews.Title: “London”
Reviews.Author: Gracielas
Reviews.Content: Great apartment 1 min away from 2 different tube stations, so you can connect easily to diferent points in town as well as a bus stop 1 min from the front door and a few minutes walk to the bus that takes you to Camdem Town. Very good comunications. Bars, restaurants and several supermarkets as well as a shopping center in within a 5 minutes walk. The apartments are clean and warm. "Ikea" tipe of decorations. Clean bathroom, with hot towel rack ( very nice) and shower. Bed is average but ok. Flat TV ( small )Has as kichenette, microwave, fridge, forks, knifes..pretty much you are cover for some easy cooking, or easier microwave any gorgeous ready made meal. There is no room service and apartment is cleaned once if staying for a week or over. If you need hairdryer you need to leave a 20 pounds deposit as well as for adaptors or 5 pounds if you want your baggage stored on the day you leave the apartment before going to the airport. Free wifi in the lobby and a coffe machine. Fits wonderfully for a London break.

Reviews.Title: “Looks are Deceiving..”
Reviews.Author: LucyHumphries
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews on here,this hotel didn't sound too promising. But when we arrived here, it wasn't as bad as we thought it would be. Although, our shower was broken, the bed was rock hard with flat pillows, the tv remote had no back - just batteries celotaped in. This didn't give a very good impression, and gave it a tacky feeling. The lift was slow, and there are no stairs apart from the fire exit. The lock on our door was about 2ft from the floor, meaning you have to pretty much break your back to reach it.. Apart from all this, there was no major problems with our stay here, and the location was brilliant. And it is recomended if you just want somewhere to sleep if your out and about a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Bad Service”
Reviews.Author: imaginationss
Reviews.Content: While the location, facade and cost of these apartments would suggest a high quality of service these apartments are very deceiving. The number of other guests we overheard (not difficult when the only wifi is in the reception area) complaining to reception staff was appalling & each time the reception staff failed to satisfy the legimate concerns of patrons. Probably the most significant of these encounters was the guest who ripped into the reception staff (who by the way are the only staff) for supplying incorrect rooms following her request and payment for several rooms of the same quality all next to each other. She was given varying rooms of varying quality on several different floors. The staff had no explanation or solution. Another patron had accidentally double booked online after a credit card malfunction (which the staff understood and knew before her arrival) however they refused to refund the second room, which the guest clearly would not be using! Our basement room was reasonable but not brilliant however the once weekly cleaning (including rubbish disposal and replacement of things such as toilet rolls) was concerning. Perhaps most concerning however was the curious business of the luggage storage room. Some of the reception staff (there are perhaps four to five people who work at the desk, no others) charged Â£5 for luggage storage whilst others charged nothing. It appeared that there was a small side business going on there for some employees....

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: lisa d
Reviews.Content: There was a cockroach infestation in our room. I saw at least 5 young cockroaches, which were running in and out of a hole in the wall just next to the shower. Wasn't very clean, hard bed with flat pillow, crappy shower, very basic room. The ONLY good point was the location. Not worth sharing with cockroaches, though.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay but first impressions were not great”
Reviews.Author: SJ1988
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed here over the last week- my first impressions...Location- Excellent a 2 minute walk from Queensway and very easy to find. Check in- Ok, foreign, the housekeeper couldnt speak english and unfortunately couldnt direct me back to reception (confusing corridors). The room- very dissatisfied- I had asked to be placed on the first floor as i cannot use lifts, and i was put right at the top floor.... millions of stairs later...the room was small, not what i had booked or seen ''medium double luxury''..there was a dead bee on the floor, the view looked back onto the dingy opposites of another hotel/hostel and the towels on the bed were soaking wet? The wall was badly marked by people moving the TV also. I addressed my situation with a receptionist who was happy to show me a different room, BUT was in the basement? This room was much bigger in size, which i wanted but the views, not so. I took the room and the receptionist was very laid back about the situation. I found it odd that even as an apartment, no body came to clean? make the beds or change the towels? There are also no facilities to wash up with so bring your own dish cloth, fairy liquid and dryer! I did have a good stay but it could have been made better by facilities such as compendiums in the rooms, i had no idea how to get anywhere etc and a comfier bed. The stay was made better by the fact of the room move and also the fact the shower was strong . I would stay here again as it was very cheap and in an ideal location but if you are not happy with your room ask to move!

Reviews.Title: “Small, but well located. NOT a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: siCTR
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in January. We knew at around Â£65 this was cheaper than a hotel and was well located. We didnâ€™t expect a lot, but this place was still smaller than I imagined! We booked a â€˜medium suiteâ€™ as the website gave the impression that it was larger than the â€˜double luxury studioâ€™ and had a small seating area that included an armchair and a table. Itâ€™s true that the medium suite is in a slightly longer room, but the only real difference is that in the double you sleep with the kitchenette parallel with you, whereas in the â€˜suiteâ€™ itâ€™s a couple of feet further away. The pictures are an accurate representation of the rooms, itâ€™s just that theyâ€™re photographed very cleverly in order to make them seem more spacious. Our apartment was in the main building at 8-18 Inverness Terrace. We were initially given a basement â€˜suiteâ€™ which was incredibly warm and people walking around above generated a lot of noise. It did not appear to match the website pictures as it was lacking the armchair and table. To be fair to the staff, they were very accommodating â€“ we dealt with Arthur who tried to help out as much as possible. I initially thought I had wrongly been given a â€˜double studioâ€™ rather than the â€˜medium suiteâ€™. Arthur therefore gave me the keys to another room and invited me to inspect it â€“ this room was on floor 4 at the top of the building. I then realised that the â€˜medium suitesâ€™ are indeed small. However, this room had an armchair and table and was much cooler than the basement flat (although the downside is that it is more sensitive to noise coming from outside on the street!). We opted to go for the top floor room since the basement was too warm (even for January!). However, upon our return to reception Arthur noted that we still felt disappointed with the room and allowed us to instead stay in the â€˜Executive Luxury Suiteâ€™ on the top floor. We were very happy with this room â€“ the kitchen and the bedroom were in separate areas, but the room was still essentially open-plan. The room also contained a small dining table with four seats. The kitchen area contained a sofa bed, but this room would be pretty cramped for four people. I canâ€™t imagine weâ€™d want to pay the full price for the â€˜Executive Luxury Suiteâ€™. My advice is that if you only intend to sleep and shower in your room then this is a fantastic location in London â€“ you might as well book the cheapest room and accept that youâ€™ll be living in a small area. If you want more space then book a hotel instead. Just to point out that aside from the kitchen equipment (plates/glasses, cutlery), the only things provided are towels, bed sheets, toilet roll and soap. The â€˜Power Showerâ€™ is pretty feeble and itâ€™s a bit of a cheek to call it that. The bathroom is very small with not much room to move in the shower. The beds are fixed next to the wall, so if there are two of you then one is going to have to climb in and out of the bed at the bottom end rather than from the side. The ironing board tiny, although there is plenty of space in the wardrobe. If you go into this with your eyes open then Iâ€™m sure youâ€™ll be happy.

Reviews.Title: “Executive?”
Reviews.Author: Ben W
Reviews.Content: Overall, we enjoyed our stay at this property. It's in a very convenient location, the staff were friendly and helpful, and we were comfortable there. However, there were a few issues: - Strange microwave not functioning properly, instructions only in Spanish - No dishwashing detergent, dish cloths or drying towels - No tea, coffee, sugar etc This may be fair enough if you're staying in a hostel, but to call the accommodation "Executive Apartments" and have these type of problems is not really good enough.

Reviews.Title: “It's not like any hotel you've ever stayed at, in fact it's not even a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sagekilz
Reviews.Content: Went to London the first week of November for my honeymoon and stayed at the Hyde Park Executive Apartments for 1 full week. Positives: GREAT location - you're 30 feet from the Tube and seconds away from actual Hyde Park, which is amazing. Area is REAL London in that it's not a tourist death trap with people snapping pictures in front of you ever 5 seconds. The room was fully equipped for a weeks stay with shower full kitchen, and rear "balcony". Negatives: No "front desk" to speak of so if you needed anything you had to get it yourself, i.e. shampoo, toilet paper, towels, etc. Don't know if it has been fixed since but the elevator was out of service and lugging 3 pieces of luggage 3 flights of stairs is not much fun. Additionally, since there was no front desk, no one was there to help. The floor and walls seemed to be made out of paper because you hear everything, I mean everything. We literally thought there was someone tap dancing above us for about 4 hours every night. We Americans are used to huge rooms with all the frills but the UK is different. The bathroom is unimaginably tiny - I'm talking you can barely turn around while in the shower. The bed was atrocious - small and like sleeping on gravel. I can't stress how small the rooms were even though they look spacious in the pictures - THEY ARE SMALL. There is no maid service like at a hotel chain so make sure you're a clean person. Good luck making a phone call as there is a phone but no instructions as to how to use it - sounds silly but trust me, we tried for 10 minutes to make a call to no avail. Overall it was a great location and fortunately we were only in the room to sleep but I do not recommend this hotel/apartment, spend the extra $20 a night a go to a chain.

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: sarah_weston2000
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly suprised by our apartment. It was spacious, clean and had a nice little kitchen area. The location was very handy also with good transport links. The only criticism would be the slightly aged mattress and the disconcerting screech that it made each time i moved. There was some noise from people coming and going but it was new years eve so to be expected!

Reviews.Title: “Don't get fooled by the website!”
Reviews.Author: Brisbaneandy
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the apartments from 27th dec for 3 nights. Despite having booked a medium suite I was put in a room around the size of a normal hotel bathroom and advised I needed to take it up with Booking.com as the hotel couldn't help. As for the room, it was overly warm due to a heated towel rail that you couldn't turn off, we had a tv that didn't work and a bed that had never had the mattress flipped. Sheets had cigarette burns in them and the toaster set off the smoke alarm whenever used despite being emptied of crumbs. On to the bathroom and the shower head holder was broken so you had no choice but to hold the shower while using it. When we tried to complain the staff were very abrupt and very unhelpful, even getting an extra pillow was a chore too far for them. Such a shame as location wise it was perfect

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Michelle H
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at these apartments, (room 211) and had no reason to complain, nor did we see anyone else doing so. Staff were pleasant and helpful. The Location is fantastic, 2 minute walk to Queensway or Bayswater Tube, 1 minute walk to Hyde Park. Bayswater is a great area with lots of shops, restaurants and supermarkets. We were happy with the room/bathroom, which was clean and modern. It was useful to have a small kitchenette with cooking facilities - a two ringed cooker, microwave, toaster, fridge, a few pans etc Our room was at the back of hotel making it quiet, overlooking a yard and other apartments opposite. Bed was ok but noisy with the slightest movement, one side of double bed tight to the wall which would disturb partner if you had to get up in middle of the night. Ceiling seemed thin, you can hear people walking around upstairs. Room cleaning/bed linen/towel changes only get done once a week. Facilities we used were Free Internet access in the Lobby and the Left luggage area (costs Â£5 per room). Overall we didnâ€™t spend much time in the apartment as we where exploring London but we believe the apartment suited the purpose of our stay well, a cheaper alternative to a hotel and advantage of cooking easy meals and making cups of tea/coffee. Great value for money (we paid Â£430 for 6 nights) as long as you don't expect to be staying in a massive space (which you wonâ€™t find in London anyway) you will love it. We will definitely stay again and recommend to others, donâ€™t be put off by others comments on here. Tip Ask for a room at the back and also a high floor they will be quieter.

Reviews.Title: “More like "Hyde Park Run Down Student Residence"”
Reviews.Author: monty69Edinburgh
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on a business trip. Seemed like a good deal at Â£99 per night. First impressions good on arrival. I thought it was a bit strange that you have to sign a "tenancy agreement" on check in, not sure why that is. I was told that I was getting a bigger room than the one I booked, so I made my way to the room with anticipation. The hallways looked very run down - stained carpet and scraped walls. My room was in the basement, facing the busy main road and was extrememly noisy throughout the night meaning that I didn't get a wink of sleep. The room was very basic and cheaply furnished. It was useful to have a tiny kitchenette, although I was reluctant to use it looking at the general cleanliness of the room. The wall was stained beside the bed, the wooden floor was chipped and split and there were silverfish crawling in the shower tray - yuck. The location of these apartments is good - close to the tube stop and Bayswater is a great area with lots of shops and restaurants. Overall, I think theis place has a cheek to refer to itself as Executive Apartments. At best, I would consider it as a good hostel. Definately would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “cheap and very cheerful”
Reviews.Author: tinabena
Reviews.Content: I was happy with the room. it was very clean and modern. pleasant and helpful staff. not a bad location and great price. will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, though short, stay”
Reviews.Author: AnnaGrafvonAra
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night as an end to our 5-days stay in London. The receptionist's were very helpful and could check us in though we arrived early. The room was newly refurbished, but situated in the lower floor, so we had to walk down a steep staircase inside the room to actually make it to the room. The Hotel is in a street located right next to Queensway where you can find a lot of different food shops and places to eat as well as Queensway underground station, which was very convenient. We did not get much sleep though since there seemed to be a party in the room above us. This is of course not the hotel's fault, but we would have liked there to be some one on the night shift to notify. Though, all in all, we had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: twilight_amoeba
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the standard double room were situated beneath the building itself. There is a lift to get from reception to all the floors. The room was much smaller than appears in the photos on the website, but was very clean. Sparsely furnished in white and pine with creaky flooring and very basic kitchen equipment. The room itself was incredibly warm, and one had to choose between a lot of noise from outside, overheating, or leaving the noisy fan on. The windows themselves are not double glazed, and the noise from corridors and other rooms is quite loud (could hear people showering). No cleaning items left in the room to use, so one had to purchase washing up liquid, sponges and cloths. A table or sofa would have been nice, and the bed was uncomfortable, only provided with two pillows, one which was very lumpy and one that was incredibly thin. The bathroom was very clean with two toilet rolls provided, and 5 towels (Two hand towels, one bathmat and two medium towels). Large mirror. The bathroom tends to get very hot if one closes the door. Small sink with glass shelf. Great location though, very close to two underground tube stations: Queensway and Bayswater, and considering London prices it was affordable. Close to small supermarkets and cafes. 1 minute walk from Hyde park. Overall good location, average hotel. Needs some improvements, but for one or two nights OK. Noisy. Could do with some more kitchen equipment so one can make use of the kitchen-et and actually cook!

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: Steven062
Reviews.Content: This seems to be 3 old terrace places converted into the one complex. Rooms are all over the place and it is like a bit of a rabbit warren! The rooms are sparsley furnished and it is all boring pine. The bed, however was quite comfortable. I wouldn't want to be here in summer, as our room was very warm - even though the outside temperature was around 15 to 20 degrees celsius. We needed to have the fan on constantly - no air conditioning. There was a large window that could be opened, but there was a walkway outside it connecting the 2 buildings - so not advisable to leave it open. We had some early starts each day, but there was no clock in the room and no phone for a wake up call! The coin laundry facility on the premises was appreciated, but no vending machine for washing powder. The microwave was complicated to use - some printed instructions would have been good! Although there was room, there was no table and chairs for eating at - just a small bench with 2 stools. On the plus side - it is in a good location and close to 2 underground stations (Queensway and Bayswater). There is also coin internet access in the reception area and a good shopping strip close by with a number of affordable eating places.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap accommodation”
Reviews.Author: Alfida
Reviews.Content: Agree with summer789 - these apartments are quite small but appear larger on the website. The bed is small and rather uncomfortable, ok for a night or two but I wouldn't like to stay here any longer. Overall well priced for London and quite convenient. Unfortunately there is no alarm clock in the room, so make sure that you have your own.

Reviews.Title: “ok”
Reviews.Author: lara m
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel for three months and the room was very small and not cheap. THe bathroom very small and and the bed not so long. The kitchen includes a refrigerator, a table, the toaster and the microwaves....cooking is very difficult. You have to pay everything ( internet connession, deposit for the baggage, hair dryer, coffee. The staff is very polite even if there are sometimes some problems with the organization. The hotel is not very clean and sometimes it smells bad because are not windows in in the narrow corridors that divide the rooms. I have had a problem with the restitution of the deposit. They have debited some costs because they had been wrong to make the accounts during the booking. Not really fair...

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, located near to 2 tube stations and half the price of a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: summer789
Reviews.Content: I heard about this place from a relative living in London who had actually looked at the room herself for me and I had neglected to read reviews myself on tripadvisor. I had a look on the apartments' website. They are studio apartments. They appear larger on the website than they are in actuality. When we arrived. check-in was smooth, front desk staff helpful. Their helpfulness extended for our 4 night stay. We paid 89 GBP per night. The room was clean but I only learned by asking that housekeeping services work differently here. There is no daily cleaning of the room as in a regular hotel. The room is cleaned weekly if your stay exceeds a week. You can have daily fresh towel changes if you request at the front desk and items such as soap, toilet paper, shampoo etc are stored at the front desk and will be given to you if you need replenishing. You take the latter up yourself. Housekeeping will put the clean towels in your room for you. The room/apartment has kitchen sink, small fridge, microwave, cook -top, a few dishes, toaster and kettle. I liked the proximity to the tube stations, Bayswater and Queensway, Bayswater is also just about 6 stops away on a direct line from Victoria Station where one arrives with the Gatwick Express from Gatwick Airport assuming that is your arrival airport. I also liked the proximity within walking distance of the variety of good restaurants. Our room was on the 4th floor. Thankfully this allowed us to sleep with the window open, since there were 2 nights when it was reasonably warm and with only a fan it got a little uncomfortable. You have to pay a 20GBP deposit for a hairdryer if you wish to have one in the room. There is an iron and ironing board in the room. The free wifi is only in the lobby not in the room. Overall, I believe the apartment suited the purpose of our stay well. I would advise booking early as this place seems to fill up quite quickly. Summer may not be the best time to stay as I expect it is unbearably hot.

Reviews.Title: “An oven in October”
Reviews.Author: Mark F
Reviews.Content: I have to admit to being seduced by the name of this hotel but I ound it quite misleading. My room was in the basement so natural light was poor at all times of the day. There was no air conditioning nor extractor fan in the bathroom, so the room was a bit of a sauna. If I opened the window it was very noisy. There was a fan supplied but it made such a racket that I had to switch it off during the night and so ended up trying to sleep while drenched in sweat. I don't know how it got a 4* rating and I wouldn't touch it again.

Reviews.Title: “Please don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: BlodynAnglesey
Reviews.Content: Ok I was a fool thinking that the 4* rating and lastminute deal would make it all ok. A colleague and I were going to a conference in National Hall and thought this would suit us. I have attached pictures which only tell a small story. We thought the street looked a bit rough with posters telling people not to hang around in the doorways and stairwells after 9pm which we though odd. The appartment is a room in fact with sink, fridge bathroom TV, M/wave all fine but very small and smelled of smoke (non smoking room). The worse thing was that we were in the basement (my colleague was 'upgraded' which seemed to mean she had 2 beds and her room was off street) It was an absolute maze in the basement and no sign posts to help find the rooms. It wasn't straightforward and very rabbit warren like. My room window was just below street level with steps down from the street to a sash window. It was a little unnerving by day but the night was horrendus. Gangs of men were congregating in the street drunk shouting, bottles smashing and what sounded like someone kicking a door throughout the night. I was too afraid to move or put a light on in case they realised someone was in the room and they came down the stairs to the window. I really don't think the room should have been given to a lone female. I see in the other reviews they were just picking up the keys from Inverness Terrace and sent to Talbot Road but we were in Inverness Ter. The walk from my room to my colleagues was also interesting as it took you to a sort of inside the biuilding but outside with no roof 'courtyard' (really can't think or a word!) which you can see it the pictures. It was gross and covered in bird poo as you can see. Please don't stay here it's more of a hostel. Staff on desk were very nice is my only plus and room was clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, not a 4*”
Reviews.Author: Anwar B
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hyde Park Exec Apartments from the 1-5th Oct 2011. We arrived at 9am and were told that our room would only be available at 2pm. We were tired after a 11hr flight from South Africa and needed to shower and have a nap to recharge and begin exploring London. Our room that we requested wasnt ready so we were given the option to check in early into the basement room. We were tired and desperate so we accepted the room. Its really small but comfortable at the rate we paid. The shower is minute but we managed. The rooms are not cleaned daily and towels are only replaced on request. If you are looking for a place to stay with big rooms this is a no no, but if you are looking for a decent room, but if you are looking for convenience and a great location. GO FOR IT.The location is amazing, especially being close to the Bayswater and Queensway tube stations. Bayswater Rd has an amazing vibe and is always busy and Tesco and Sainsbury are easily accessible. Whiteleys Mall is also on Bayswater Rd and offers great value. We are Muslim and Halaal food is easily accessible on Bayswater Rd (including Subway).

Reviews.Title: “Executive??”
Reviews.Author: mhp74
Reviews.Content: When I arrived at 5 in the afternoon I was told, after my payment, that there was no room available for me for that night!!! I was transferred to a different hotel without the promised kitchen and due to all the delay almost missed the theatre I had booked for that evening. Lost a lot of time changing hotel again in the morning and was NOT compensated!!! There was no air conditioning so the room was very hot. Everything is impersonal and very basic, nothing like the photos shown on booking.com! Feels more like a hostal. The only good thing about this 'hotel' is the location. Very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting! Lovely reception gent but quoted policy all the way and had to refer everything to 'the manager' by phone!!”
Reviews.Author: HolsRUs2011
Reviews.Content: The pictures give an indication of how grim this place is. If you are on a really tight budget travelling, have your own sleeping bag and low expectations this could be ok. The beds and linen are just totally disgusting. Whatever you do DO NOT hand over cash or any form of payment until you've seen your room first because they won't just charge you you're first nights stay but if you've booked for longer they will take two and refund Amy future nights. I arrived at 7pm on my first night, complained... I wish I'd taken photos of the first room given to me including mattress stained yellow and pillows but I didn't think to do this. I told the gent on reception that I would not be staying for the remaining 3 nights and he told me that he would only refund 2 of the 5 nights I booked!!!!! It is a great area. So many options but a major let down.

Reviews.Title: “Downsized Executives”
Reviews.Author: rkneuman
Reviews.Content: These lodgings were vastly overpriced. If you're setting up housekeeping in London and can negotiate a better tariff, it may be suitable but it is definitely not desirable for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but slightly overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Steven H
Reviews.Content: Overall my partner and I found this place to be very clean, friendly and worth the travelling distance from King's Cross station. The website's photographs are rather misleading, as the rooms are rather small, unlike what the photographs appear to show. Nonetheless the rooms are well furbished and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised!”
Reviews.Author: Ddee270686
Reviews.Content: i booked this apartment then looked it up on trip adviser, which really i should have done the other way around! i was horrified to find all the awful reviews about these apartments and was worried until we checked it, the receptionist was very good, our room was small but it had everything we needed and it was clean, i understand the many comments about the heat in the basement (we were in B06) but i wasnt unbearable and was fine with the fan they already left in the room,the kitchen facilities were ok for what we needed, i didnt hear any of our neighbours and had no reason to complain nor did we see anyone else complain, the location was fantastic, great tube access and great local pubs/places to eat, i would definatly recomend these apartments, im glad i stuck with my original perception of these apartments and wasnt put off by other comments

Reviews.Title: “False Advertising”
Reviews.Author: DominiqueC27
Reviews.Content: Utilitarian ,clean but by no means "executive". The photos are misleading.I felt very sorry for the staff that spend about 80% of the time dealing with very unhappy guests.Each time we passed reception there were groups of people complaining.Missing bookings, not what they were promised, no clean towels, what do you means no acess to basic things we need because housekeeping gone home. Our kettle was so rusted I wonder how many people have become ill from it. The bed was pushed against the wall not user friendly for a roomfor more than 1 person and especially someone a little older.The TV was dark and adjusted to red hues and could not be sorted out. I had to leave the shower doors open in order to be able to wash my hair! Why , because it was so small. We asked for a taxi to paddington about 1km away and were charged 11 pounds!!!!! What a rip off arranged by hotel.... Kick back heaven..... Not worth the price.... please look at the other 900 odd places available in London

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: thedomino
Reviews.Content: When I found this hotel on the website I thought WOW, this looks brilliant and especially for the price. However upon arriving, this wow factor soon disappeared. The pictures on the website are 100% misleading, the rooms are tiny and depressing. The reception staff were nice enough but also very clueless. They had no idea what was going on. They gave us a key to a bedroom, to which we opened to find a family still in the room! we went back up and they lied, saying the cleaners were still preparing it. Well...if the cleaners are a family of 4 and bring their crying babies to work, then maybe they're correct. From here it got worse, as we were sent to a new room that was hotter than a sauna, with no apparent ventilation other than a window which backed straight onto a dirty roof space and another room opposite. The room was basic to say the least, with a tiny tv on a bracket 10 ft up the wall like you were in a dentist waiting room. The sofa was positioned cleverly underneath this, so you couldnt see it. the bathroom was tiny and had no ventilation, so a shower became a fight for breath. The bed was up a precarious staircase that had the shallowest and steepest steps imaginable. In fairness we barely spent any time in the 'executive' apartments, as we spent all of our time out exploring London, which was a good job, as the only time spent in there was a nightmare. We barely slept a wink, as the walls were so thin we could hear every single sound from all around. Some kids were playing music till well after 3 in the morning and screaming and shouting about. this coupled with the unbelievable heat that was in the raised bedroom, meant a terrible nights sleep. The only thing we cannot fault is the location, it is in a brilliant position and the area is really nice. Its just a shame that the apartments dont justify their position. do NOT stay here...

Reviews.Title: “No! No! No! Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Peter B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights! The Hotel is located 2 minutes from Kensington Park and 1 minute walk from the Queensway Tube Station (thats the good points over with) The reception staff are unhelpful and come across as not really having a clue whats going on! The room was acceptable is terms of cleanliness and had the basics needed, the size of the room was akin to student accomadation, it was hot and very noisy all day and night the bed was marginally better than sleeping on the floor and the shower was sometimes hot sometimes cold or surprised you throughout going from one to the other and back again. Whilst at reception another couple who were staying for 2 weeks had asked when the room would be cleaned etc over their stay and was advised they only get cleaned and changed every 7 days! We booked with Thomson Cook (Superbreak) and the pictures shown to use at the time of booking were not the actual room etc that you get offered!! My advice to anyone wanting to stay here is DONT!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KerrySpiers
Reviews.Content: I stayed here down to the positive reviews on here. However I will not be going back. The room was boiling hot, the bathroom even hotter and despite having the fan and window open all night it was still baking that we couldn't sleep. The reception was slow and they didn't seem to know what they were doing, ie when we went to collect our bag he was happy for us to just pick one from a massive pile (even though ours weren't there!). The pillows were flat as a pancake and the towels were hard and rough. I know this is a cheap hotel, in a great location however I know there are plenty of other places (even on the same road) that are just as good for the same price and even more central. To be fair to the hotel, the room was clean and well presented and the bathroom was clean and modern.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Recommend”
Reviews.Author: Justine G
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two days in July and found there was more wrong than right about it. The word "Executive" is certainly not a fair description unless you pay for one of the large suites and the pictures on the website are VERY misleading. You basically get a small bedroom with a kitchen unit and a small shower room, ideal for one on a short stay but not for two people. Clean but lots of wear and tear, cutlery, dishes and utensils missing, very noisy both inside and out and VERY hot. Next door to a Youth Hostel so expect loud partying until early hours! Between noise, heat and uncomfortable bed, I had minimal sleep during the trip. On check in they ask you to sign a form authorising they can take up to Â£500 from your credit card for any "damages or extra charges incurred during your stay", a Â£20 deposit is required to use their hair dryer and Â£5 to use an ethernet cable. Only redeeming feature is location but there are many other hotels in the vicinity that would be better!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: CatlondonUS
Reviews.Content: The value is pretty good for this hotel. The location is convenient for the Central Line and nice in summer when you can stroll in Kensington Gardens. The decor is a little tired and there were building works going on when we were there. It was a bit warm and we were on the lower ground floor so could not open the window.

Reviews.Title: “Large room for 4 people, Good price”
Reviews.Author: lalitravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a basement room. The room was very clean, ideal size for a two double bed room, came with eveything we needed. Having a kitchen is a real plus and there are plenty of shops nearby. The price for all 4 of us was great. The downsides were: it was HOT in the room - we had a fan in the room which we left that on all night. The window was very near the neighbours so we had to keep the blind down. Also. people would pass right next to the window which was a problem of privacy. The foldaway sofa bed was not comfy so we put the mattress on the floor. The rooms are NOT serviced, so this is an issue if you stay more than a couple of days. No regular phone in the room.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: peterwharper
Reviews.Content: Really nice apartment, very modern. We arrived early and allowed to check in early at no extra charge, the staff were very friendly. The apartment is in an ideal location about a minutes walk from Queensway underground. Over all i couldn't fault the stay apart from finding a dead cockroach and a rather large beetle; i believe this was due to living in the lower basement.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4star but delighted with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: MrsCanDo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hyde Park Exec Apartments for 3 nights in July 2011 on a trip to London with my mother. It was a busy time in London and I had struggled to find reasonable accommodation, so when this room came up on Lastminute.com I booked it out of desperation despite the negative reviews. The room (Room 020) was on the ground level. It was small but perfectly adequate. It was spotlessly clean with a powerful shower. The bed was a standard double and comfortable enough. It would've been more comfortable if there had been extra pillows on the bed but it didn't stop us getting a good night's sleep. The fridge was clean as was the 2 plate hob. There were enough cups, bowls etc to make a cup of coffee and basic foods if needed (with a Sainsburys and Tesco within walking distance if you want to buy some basics). Very centrally located to Queensway (District line) and Bayswater (Circle line) with a bus stop near the front door. The area is lively with lots of restaurants & shops nearby. The staff were very efficient and friendly and had no problem when we arrived to check in muh earlier than arranged. We found the room quite warm but a fan was brought up to our room as soon as we asked for it. On our second night the people in the room next door were VERY noisy and could be clearly heard in our room, but we were so tired from our travels that they hardly kept us awake. My main criticism would be the lack of pillows on the bed and lack of mirror near a plug point (something lots of us ladies with hairdryers cannot do without haha) but they aren't major gripes and didn't detract from our stay. I wouldn't recommend the apartments for travellers who are looking for luxury but if you're after something basic, centrally located & good value you can't go far wrong!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean apartment - can't go wrong for the price”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneM_10
Reviews.Content: Staying in London can cost a fortune. This studio apartment only cost Â£100 for the night and it was spot on. The room was bright, clean and comfortable. Shower was lovely and powerful. It was a hot room as we were in the basement but for one night it was fine. One thing they do need in that room (B03) is a new bed - it is very noisy and no spare pillows. These apartments (Medium Suite Luxury which is what we paid for) is more like a studio apartment but we have no complaints. Polite on arrival and check out. Tip: Basement room are quite hot so ask for another level room if possible. They also ask you to fill our your credit card details on arrival (just in case you break something) - i asked for these back when i checked out as was not comfortable leaving them with the staff. They also ask for a passport or driving licence to check before checking you in - again i think this is because there are so many apartments its hard to keep track or everyone and to get the money back if something has been damaged. Not the same at hotels so slightly strange but i didnt mind. Nearest tube is Queensway not Bayswater (turn right out of the tube station and then left and it will be on your left in 2 mins)

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there it's a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: Ilovetravelling76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on 2nd July 2011. Nothing executive about it what so ever. We paid Â£149/night, because it was a Saturday night rate. On Sunday it is reduced to Â£70, which is a more realistic rate for this apartment. Room No. 26 was actually very small and the walls might as well have been as thin as paper. I'd say it wasclean but the bed was uncomfortable. There is a skylight that has no blind so the light streamed in very early in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Far from 'Executive' - Will not use again”
Reviews.Author: Eunos1989
Reviews.Content: I was quite excited about this new stop over. I visit London at least once a month. Reception impressions were they were uninterested but never mind...we all have bad days. I got this room during a busy time for London and hotels were a premium. Room impressions poor. The rooms are clean but unexciting and dull. Shower was poor (one of my 'must haves' when in London, especially after a long tube ride). Bathroom soaps/gels minimal I certainly would not want to stay more than a night. Positives are its a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal!”
Reviews.Author: AmyAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I was really wating for the catch as this place is far less expensive than most hotels with more than two stars. There is no catch! Even though I arrived before lunch there was a room ready for me and I could check in straight away. Very nice. The room was clean and bright and reasnalble in size. Coulors where frwsh, white sheets and light wood, a nice change from the flowery decor often found in low key London hotels. Bathroom is small but modern, the shower big enough with a nice shower head and great water pressure/temprature. Kitchen is small and there was only one frying pan, no other cooking materials but I did not plan to cook there anyway. It was nice to have a fridge in the room, it was big and made no noise what so ever. Microwave and bread toaster where clean and very uasable. Bed was not really big but large enough for two. A little soft for my licking but comfortable. Pillows a litte flat but for a few nights stay it will do. Staff at front desk was very helpfull and check in and out was very swfift. Location is great, a 2 min walk from Queensway station so very central, Hyde park across the road and the bayswater earea is a lively one with enough restauants, pubs, supermarkets and such stores withing 5 min. of walking. Of course there is no breakfast included but with the fridge and toaster you can make a one yourself of just nip out and eat at a cafe around the corner. For the price it will be hard to find a acomodation that will beat this one. It is noit a 4star place, nor a luchourious one but for a short stay in London it is comfortable at a more than reasnable price. Eigther spend a lot more money on a 4 star hotel or book this for a cheap but very chearfull option. Amy

Reviews.Title: “NOT UP TO EXPECTATIONS”
Reviews.Author: BJLPerth
Reviews.Content: The room we were given was very small, nothing like the spacious looking pictures. We could only just lay our suitcases on the floor between the wall and the bed. The bed was scrunched into a corner, very uncomfortable and not really big enough for two adults. It was also the noisiest place we stayed in, other guests were still partying at 4am and the noise came right through the paper thin walls. It was also incredibly hot, but you couldn't open the window because of the street and traffic noise. We lasted one night out of our booking of three nights. After just an hour or so's sleep, the first thing we did in the morning was to go and look for another place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Low-priced central accommodation”
Reviews.Author: KiwiGran2010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are middle-aged and stayed for five nights in The Hyde Park Executive Apartments in late April this year. The Apartments are located very close to Bayswater and Queensway underground stations (about two minutes flat walk). The rooms have a microwave, sink and utensils. I don't recommend you use the toaster though because it sets off the smoke alarm (as it did all over the building in other rooms). These are NOT LUXURY apartments, and with prices comparable with B&Bâ€™s providing similar self-contained facilities, we didnâ€™t expect them to be. Itâ€™s not a hotel so there is no bar or restaurant or even a lounge (except for a sofa in the reception area). If you are going to spend a lot of your time in your room and want lovely surroundings, then donâ€™t stay there. The rooms are generally small but clean and tidy. Unless you get a room which overlooks the street, you will probably have a view of other windows (some quite close). We got up early every day and didnâ€™t come back until the evening so didnâ€™t need to spend good money on pretty surroundings. Having read various reviews on here (before making our reservation) about noise, we slept (very soundly) with ear plugs! We initially had a room on the third floor overlooking the street which got all day sun. The room got so hot we couldn't sleep at night (there's no air conditioning in the building). That room was very small. We declined the offer of a fan and were moved to a much larger room on the ground floor (not the basement) which even had one chair! It had two windows, both of which looked into a stairwell with other windows very close but the temperature was much better. We found the staff to be helpful and polite but not what I would call friendly - more business-like (quite different to the staff we met when we stayed at the Premier Inns). Towels and linen are changed on request (weekly from memory, otherwise).

Reviews.Title: “Location location”
Reviews.Author: ecimadh
Reviews.Content: In short i would say that the location of the place is great , IT was 3 minutes walk to nearest tube but yes in central London you are never too far from a tube station. Well the room size was very small but it was with all the facilities that one can expect. The heating was fine with a full kitchen net and fridge etc. The bathroom size was really small but that's ok when you are living in central London you can't expect a big room for 80pounds a night. All in all a great place to stay for budget travellers , A Indian restaurant was right next and for all curry lovers a great place as they offer all you can eat just for 7 P a person. The hotel staff was helpful during the stay but they just have one person at reception so sometimes you might have to wait for you to be attended. Lots of restaurants around as the this is right next to Oxford tube station so food absolutely no issue at all Only thing worth noting is that they clean only once a stay so if you are staying longer be prepared to spend extra bucks for cleaning during your stay

Reviews.Title: “Great value, no complaints”
Reviews.Author: misterdeef
Reviews.Content: For the money, this place is an excellent find. I had a spacious, spotless, modern room, comfy bed (might have been a bit small for two), and had a nice quiet night. Will certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Not executive, barely an apartment!”
Reviews.Author: BAN100
Reviews.Content: Booked by my daughters to facilitate an anniversary trip to the C helsea Flower Show as a special treat! What we got was a subterranean room with a double bed, a wardrobe, a kitchen area with 2 rings, a fridge, a microwave and a toaster, two stools and just one chair,n probably because there was no room for another one. The room was very hot, but because the window was of sash construction there was no way of securing it in the open position. This one window looked out onto a courtyard, which was used as a passage, so the blind had to be permanently down to prevent other guests looking in. The only good thing about this property is the location - close to Hyde Park & the tube stations.

Reviews.Title: “Not executive - but certainly bargain for Â£70 pn in London”
Reviews.Author: forever-aurora
Reviews.Content: Good points: - location, cleanliness, spacious room, good sufficient kitchenette (although pretty useless for short stays) and there was a fan in our basement room, which was a necessity. Bad points: - lots of creepy corridors in the basement...no air con, no privacy due to the inappropriate facing of our windows looking right over to another guest's room, super slow lift, small TV, thin pillow (I had to fold my pillow to make it comfortable) Overall, it is a bargain for Â£70 but don't expect too much for a 4* - you're probably better off staying at a 4* hotel with an air con especially during the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Average...”
Reviews.Author: MASPOR
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good points: The hotel is located in a quite area within walking distance from the tube and the Hyde Park. The reception staff was very friendly and let us store our luggage before check-in and after check-out because of our bad flight itinerary. The in-room features and amenities were really good and we loved the fully equipped kitchenette and the modern bathroom. The rate was relatively cheap for central London. On the other hand, the room was very small and the bed could barely fit both of us. The view was nothing much really so we kept the curtain down during our stay. Noise could be heard from the corridor and other rooms. Last but not least, we found hair on our bed. I'm not sure if we would stay there again and I'm afraid I recommend it only to those travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “I deal for London break.”
Reviews.Author: mccue
Reviews.Content: Double rooms are ideal for short break, wood floors pretty modern decor & small kitchen work top with microwave etc, & flat screen 20in tv. Easy to keep clean and fresh. Bayswater has loads of fast food shops and resturants and two tubes with in a couple of hundred yards, we walked fifty yards into Kensington Park to look at the Palace (currently under renovation) and across the park to look at the Albert hall and statue. Very nice area and conveniant for getting into London, we were on the enbankment within twenty minutes, got back from Faithless concert in Brixton within thirty minutes of leaving O2 venue. Breakfast (full english) round corner Â£5.50 / Â£6.00. We will be going back and would book again, Executive in name probably applies to the upper level suites ! Not the Hilton but not charging Â£120 a night, for Â£70 a night absolute bargain. nice area, quiet & clean.

Reviews.Title: “Service - what service?”
Reviews.Author: 5boys1girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in these apartments for a week. The location was great. The bed was hard. The kitchen facilities were fine. The person on the desk was clear that our room would be serviced every day or two - at least twice while we were staying. We came in on a Friday night and we would have our room serviced by Wednesday at the latest. It was not. what we got were: no cleaning; no rubbish collection; no instructions for the appliances; no fresh towels ; one dish towel; 2 toilet rolls and 1 small soap for the week; no directions about where the laundry was. There was a broken rubbish bin (no lid!) No dishcloth to wipe the bench; a broken toilet brush (needed as there was no service) and no plug for the hand basin. When I complained the 'manager' told me that the desk person had no right to promise the service and that no-one had ever complained before!

Reviews.Title: “great value for money in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: hammyfizzle
Reviews.Content: the hotel is right opposite a tube station which is very convenient! also a few mins walk is hyde park. the room was really nice a clean, quite basic but had everything you need. nice little kicthenette, we didnt use it but it was nice to have a fridge. the only complaint would be that it was really hot. parking was ridiculously expensive! view was rubbish, we were looking accross to someone elses window! cheap and cheerful! just what you need when in london as you dont spend much time in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Room - Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: lalitravel
Reviews.Content: Good size room. Good size bathroom. Kitchnette with basic equipment for 2. Room was clean and seemed relatively new. Convenient location near Queensway tube station and buses. Shops close by. No landline telephone in room. No safe in room or in reception.

Reviews.Title: “Grotty room, rude staff. How it can have the audacity to claim to be a 4 star accomodation is beyond me”
Reviews.Author: Amcnallyjnr
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in some questionable abodes in my time and I'm not a very picky person. However, this place is completely misrepresented. The whole place in in major need of a refurb, including the attitude of the staff. Not once in the four days we were there did we get a "hello", let alone a "how is your stay". The room was very tired looking. Broken window that fell on my head and cut it. Snot on the wall. Tv with 4 channels (obviously haven't heard of the digital switch over). To advertise 'stylish oak flooring throughout' and be met with the cheapest looking laminate I've ever seen was, by the end, a given. Everything was mis-sold. One cup in the 'italian kitchenette'. No cleaning facilities. Had to use a hand towel and the complimentary shampoo to wash our shared cup for the coffe we had to buy at the local sainsbury's. Even the travelodge provides tea and coffee. The bed was attrocious and the pillows were pointless. We felt the bed was particularly grotty and didn't want to touch it. I wrapped a towel around the pillow. There was no change of linens for the entire stay as it only happens once a week. All in all, it was a big stain on an otherwise lovely weekend. Avoid, avoid, avoid!

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY HERE - LEAVE IT TO THE COCKROACHES!”
Reviews.Author: Kim6359
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed in the pokey little room (good photography to stretch the pictures so much!) but more so with the THREE cockroaches in the room on my last night - and they were big ones!!! They disappeared down the 1 inch gap between the floor and the wall. The cheap "kitchenette" is just about equiped - 2 glasses, 2 cups, 2 plates, 2 bowls, 2 knives, 2 forks, 2 soup spoons, 1 saucepan, 1 frying pan - NOTHING ELSE! No air con, No hairdryer, No radio, only std 5 channel TV. Saw maid cleaning the walls of the lift with cloth she had just wiped the floor with!

Reviews.Title: “Great value, Great Location, Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: carolinemaclean
Reviews.Content: We were a bit sceptical after reading some of the reviews left by others but were pleasantly surprised when we arrived, nice spacious clean room. The only suggestion I would give would be that the beds should have mattress protectors on them and have 4 pillows, it's a small irk, but didn't detract from a great stay! Would revisit and recommend to others as the location is superb.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: VildeRH
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews of this hotel, I arrived with little to no expectations - and I'm glad I did. No need to get disappointed. The rooms are nothing like the pictures shown on their website. They are absolutely TINY (especially the bathroom), and really hot (we had to sleep with the window wide open, and it was still just February and quite cold outside!), the "double bed" is more like a big single bed. Also, I'm pretty sure it says on their website that each apartment has got wireless Internet connection. This is not true. In fact, most of the apartments has not got any Internet at all, and you will have to sit in the reception to get access to it. The good thing about this hotel is the location - it is close to two different tube stations; Queensway and Bayswater. Moreover, you will find Tesco's, McDonald's, Starbucks, Subway, Bella Italia, Boots and so on just around the corner. This is not a dodgy area, but just as with any other part of London I would not recommend hanging around in the streets late at night. We went to get some food at about 2 a.m and were told by the police to watch out, apparently Queensway struggle with theft. But no worries, it is not a bad area.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Ininha
Reviews.Content: The location was great: it was realy near from 2 tube stations on main lines. The spacious room is almost perfect (it is quite spacious by European standards), but the kitchen wasn't well equipped, missing cutlery, glasses and plates. There is no air conditioner, what is very much needed in the days of summer. To minimize the heat caused by light buoy, it was necessary to keep the windows open. The windows, however, stood in front of a hall where people went and overlooking the room next door. There is therefore no possibility of security and privacy if you prefer to soften the effects of the summer. There is no room service and room cleaning is done only once a week. The reception is open only during business hours. Nearby there is good supply of restaurants, cafes, supermarkets, shopping malls and pubs. Weighing all these aspects, the excellent location, price, cleanliness and room size make the stay worth and I definitely lodge there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: matador_uk
Reviews.Content: Went to stay for 2 nights, December 3rd-5th with a couple of friends. Location was great- 2 minutes walk from 2 tube stations on main lines which was ideal. Check in was easy, no hassle- booked through Superbreaks so handed over my letter and got booked in without fuss. We were given a room on the 3rd floor, having read reviews on here I was relieved at this as basement rooms seem to get a lot of flack, but cant fault the 3rd floor room. Massive bed, clean, plenty enough space. The heating was absolutely blasting the entire time we were there but we just had the window open which was fine. If we had been in the basement or on the first floor the heat would have been stifling though as you wouldn't have had the option of leaving the window like we did. Really enjoyed staying here due tot he convenience, I would stay here again if I could ensure a 3rd floor room. Right next to the tube and some of the night bus stops which means that you're not forking out for cabs.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, good but could do better.”
Reviews.Author: jcbettinelli
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located close to two underground stations and in a area with restaurants. The people at the reception are not very friendly. We got a room in the basement, which was not so bad except that it was really noisy. We could hear people walking above us and our neighboors had a party with all windows opened. The kitchen and the bathroom provides the vital needs. I would consider going there again but not in the basement.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but very noisey hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jennyrob669
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is in a great spot to access the tube and get to the centre of London. I say hotel, but it was more like a youth hostel. Me and my colleague only stayed one night. The room was big enough for 2 of us but was located besides a corridor that went outside then inside and outside again. As in previous reviews we had to pull the blind down to get some privacy, only half the light bulbs worked so the room was very dark in the day! Was really annoyed at the Â£5 fee to store our bags so we could walk around London the next day. Every hotel I've ever been to it's free of charge to store bags! Only positives are that the location was fab and the hotel was very clean. My company booked this hotel. but personally I wouldn't book again given the choice of alternative hotels in London.

Reviews.Title: “Not Executive Apartments!”
Reviews.Author: The_Ho
Reviews.Content: Found someone else's hair in bed, skirting board hanging off, cracked tiles in bathrooom. Noisy too. Location great, service was okay, changed bedding next day.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended - Noisy, poor privacy”
Reviews.Author: pbw123
Reviews.Content: This is in no way "executive" ! More like a youth hostel with a better paint job There was a public corridor right running right past our room window, and the room opposite looked straight into ours. So in order to get privacy we had to always have the blinds closed - which totally blocked out all natural light ! From what we could see, most rooms are like this - impossible to get light AND privacy at the same time. Wooden floors throughout meant constantly being woken up as people came and went at all hours of the night. The walls are paper thin - we could hear a hushed conversation taking place in the room next door The double bed was pushed into a corner - which meant that one of us was sleeping by the wall and had to exit the bed by sliding down and climbing over the end (the bed was not movable - we tried) There were no bedside lamps The microwave was broken.The smoke detector was positioned right above the toaster, which meant an alarm with every slice of toast. No table and chairs to sit down and eat at., though there was enough space for one. Also checkin took way too long (20 minutes) as they had "lost details of our booking" Additionally, we were charged Â£5 extra to store our bags for a couple of hours after we checked out - there is no mention of this charge in the literature. So all in all: COMPLETE PANTS

Reviews.Title: “Great location but doesn't make up for all of its negative points”
Reviews.Author: beebs_79
Reviews.Content: The room was nice, small but clean and new. We stayed in September, in a basement room and it was really warm in there. It would've been very uncomfortable during the summer months. Opening the window at night wasn't an option as there is a youth hostel next door and every night of our stay we had a group of people in the street, right outside our window. Not that keeping the window shut kept the noise out! My boyfriend had to go outside twice (we only stayed for three nights) to ask them to keep the noise down. Hotel reception staff were sympathetic, but there wasn't much they could do - other than call the police, which they did. I'd read about the smoke/fire alarm problem and assumed that whoever left that review had just been unlucky. It went off around 3-4am one morning during our stay and we all had to go and gather outside. The staff seemed pretty blase about it and I got the impression that it happens fairly regularly. None of this ruined our trip - but we were out partying most nights so I'm sure that helped to fall asleep with the endless chatter outside our window. It's a real shame about the youth hostel because this hotel is in a really good location and the staff were actually very helpful - there was no safety deposit box in our room so they allowed us to use the one in their office, for example. I won't be staying again though!

Reviews.Title: “Definately NOT Deluxe Executive”
Reviews.Author: KDBarclay
Reviews.Content: The only good thing that can be said about this place is its great location. We paid over Â£90 for a "Deluxe" "Executive" apartment. We like and earlier reviewer, were stuck in a horrid basement and with people walking past banging doors all night. the room was tiny not very clean and VERY poor value for money. If you do use this hotel, please dont expect a excecutive or deluxe apartment, or you will be disapointed we have used other Apartments in London which have been 100 times better. They even tried to charge Â£5 if I wanted to leave our bags for a few hours after check out! Never has anywhere in the world tried to pull that stunt on me!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, but not if you're too fussy”
Reviews.Author: Wishiwastherestill
Reviews.Content: The apartments are in a superb location, they are clean and for the price it's fantastic to get your own kitchenette. All rooms are fitted out to a high, if fairly basic standard in a modern style. I've stayed here a few times now and it's been a mixed bag in terms of experience. It seems to depend on which room you get. This time round I had a basement room, which was quite noisy, had a smelly bathroom and wasn't dark enough in the night due to light coming in from the street level outside. As a heavy sleeper it didn't bother me too much, but if you're a fussy traveller these might be bigger issues. The only other thing I'd grumble about I suppose is that the TVs are still analogue with only the 5 basic channels. I'm starting to expect freeview as standard nowadays so this was a disappointment. Despite these issues I would still recommend the hotel as the best place I've found in London for the price - perhaps just request you don't get a basement room when you book!

Reviews.Title: “very disspaointing”
Reviews.Author: jomc82
Reviews.Content: I recently took my mum on a trip to london for her 60th with other members of my family. we were under the illusion we had booked a two bedroom apartment but were given two seperate rooms one of which had a pull up bed! The room was in the basement which was extremely hot and very noisy during the night. Shower looked like it could do with a good clean and for this price some complimentary tea/coffe would not go a miss. this place would be more siuted for students and younger people. Picture on the website are definately not what the rooms are like. Staff were nice enough but I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like student digs.”
Reviews.Author: willowHartlepooll
Reviews.Content: Very very small, not at all like photos, small double bed pushed in corner of the room so one side is against the wall. Tiny but clean bathroom. Like a hostel or student accommodation, most suited to young travellers!!

Reviews.Title: “what a great place!”
Reviews.Author: islander74
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at Hyde Park Executive Apartments with my partner and we had a great stay. The hotel was very new and clean and the staff at reception was very nice and helpful. The room had a modern kitchenette, wooden floor and a decent size bathroom with shower. Based on previous reviews I was worried about the actual bed, however our bed was surprisily very comfortable! Chatting to reception we found out that they had changed all mattreses from the property just a few days prior to our arrival! Having now fixed the apparent previous issue with the beds, I would certainly recommend this place as the value for money is great...modern and clean accommodation, 2 tube stations just 1 minute walk from the hotel, 100 mettres from Hyde Park...what else can you ask for in London for Â£80 per night?

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, nice but overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Klepstryk
Reviews.Content: Generally - reviews of this apartaments gives a true view of this accomodation. Location is more than great - two tubes nearby, hyde park just across the street; queensway street, where you can eat almost every kind of dishes (local pubs, pizzerias, kebabs, chineese, vietnameese, libaneese, greeks, india, a lot of take-aways). Apartaments are nice, clean but small. It doesn't bother us at all, but thought it'll be more spacious. Beds have soft materace - so for those who have hard materace at home - prepare on spine-pain on every morning.. Plus it was noisy - especially "in action" - and in addition to paper-made walls - hope we weren't pain-in-a** for our neighbors ;-) Service should be a lot of better for that price. Room have been cleaned just once in 10 days, we didn't get toilet paper then, and our small soap gone. Receptionists were always kind. So in other words - we dont regret - apartament was nice, our trip was good, but for that price it should be a waaay better!

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY AT THIS HOTEL...EVER”
Reviews.Author: DandKAnderson
Reviews.Content: We VERY STRONGLY advise you NEVER to stay at this hotel...we had our laptop STOLEN from our room and there was no forced entry (we found out that 2 other rooms were also broken into on the same night!!!) and indeed from speaking to locals and the police they say "typical, this happens all the time here".... the hotel management have since done nothing to recompense us for the laptop!! Think...it could be YOU if you stay here! PLUS: other reasons to find somewhere else to stay: it's NOISY, the rooms are HOT, the beds are TINY and the pillows are rubbish, the bathroom is so SMALL you can only just get it ... and we had booked an executive/suite! The rooms have actual keys to get in/out so of course it's easy for somebody to get a copy keyscut. THERE ARE PLENTY OF OTHER HOTELS TO STAY IN LONDON THAT ARE CHEAP.... DONT STAY HERE, BE WARNED....don't be fooled into thinking that you will should book to stay here because it is cheap, or in the location you want ..... there are so many other lovely hotels, book to stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Worst nights sleep ever!”
Reviews.Author: MRP81
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel/apartment as part of a last minute theatre break - luckily we only stayed for one night. We read the reviews and tried to prepare ourself for the worst however nothing could have really prepared us for the heat in the room on what was not a very hot day. We checked in and was given a basement room. We got down to the basement and before we even got into the room we were sweating ewww. We decided to ask if there was another room available and was moved to the 2nd floor which was on the front of the building. The room was still very hot so we had to keep the fan on as we couldn't have the window open due to it being too noisy. The noise in the hotel also kept us up until the early hours as we could hear people walking along the corridors and doors banging etc... I have never slept in a bed that creaks so much and the sheets had stains on them which wasn't nice. I really wouldn't recommend this hotel/apartment. Positive : The staff were nice and helpful. Great location for tube(s). Negative : Extremely noisy, Unbearably hot, Creaky bed, Stained bed sheets.

Reviews.Title: “IGNOR BAD REVEIWS!”
Reviews.Author: mizzabec
Reviews.Content: This was my first ever holiday on my own. I went to london with my boyfriend for two nights and we decided to stay in this hotel because for Â£190 for two nights in central london, who can argue??? The titile said "executive" but i reckon it was just to draw customers in and was not ment to be taken litterally (like some reveiws have). We satyed in the basement rooms, which are the ones which recieved most bad comments. But honestly i was rather impressed. The room was very clean, ideal size for a two night stay and came with eveything we needed and more. the only slight downsides were it was a little hot in the room (but your in central london with millions for cars blasting out hot exhaust fumes.) but we had a fan in the room so we just left that on all night. And the neighbours windows were a little too close but we just kept the blind down, problem solved! We were both really impressed by this hotel and would advise anyone who is being put off by the bad (and downright snobby) reveiws, to ignor them all, this is a fantastic bargain apartment hotel with a good and friendly service. P.S there are also bad comments about the beds. they are a little hard, but no wear near as bad as people are making out :) drama queens!

Reviews.Title: “nice room but nothing else”
Reviews.Author: steffenxy
Reviews.Content: I normally do not write reviews but for this Hotel I had to write one. I stayed in several places in London already and this place is from the room itself only a nice place but that is the only advantage! Disadvantages: - luggage storage(needed when you have to checkout at 12 but you don't want to take your luggage with you the whole day because you have an evening flight) is in every place i stayed before for free, here they charge 5GBP!! I've never seen such a rip off! But the best is it still is not insured and 70 EUR money was taken out of my luggage. - they do not have 24h reception(a lot smaller places in London have that) - there is no room service at all(and I don't mean for food, I only mean for cleaning the room), here some people might say it is only an apartment but this is in a lot of other places in London this is very common(in the same or even lower category). - rooms a very loud especially in the -1 level rooms - your neighbour room (window to window) is only 2m away! You can't open the window if you don't want to have someone constantly looking into your room AVOID THIS PLACE!

Reviews.Title: “Super hotel, what a great deal; this hotel is perfect for independent travellers.”
Reviews.Author: NSTravelerOrangedale
Reviews.Content: The location is very close to the underground (the Tube). The neighborhood consists of mostly hotels, and there are friendly visitors in the street at most times. In the apartment we had a double bed and a single bed a kitchen (fridge, stove and microwave) and a modern bathroom. We saved money on the rate, and on the cost of breakfast and dinner! The room is clean, and the building is secure, the staff was co-operative. If you don't need luxury (room service and spa) this is a great basic place to stay at a bargain price.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped hotel at decent price and good location”
Reviews.Author: happytravelers888
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel 2 separate nights within 2 weeks but still experienced disappointment, CONS -Room itself with little privacy and security. Basement and ground floor accomodations with windows that open into common areas. There are no window guards, so if you are in the basement, someone could literally climb into your room from the courtyard with your window open. -Noisy rooms: rooms are located along mazelike hallway with banging hallway doors and conversations that carry across common courtyard. -Front desk service friendly but slow, we frequently had to wait in line -One elevator for 5 floors including basement was slow. -Double room provided only with only one bath towel. When requested additional bath towel, manager provided 4 bath towels. -No A/C, but fan provided. PROS -Security badge needed to get into front entrance -Location near Hyde Park/Kensington Gardens excellent to jog through -Location near two Tube stations on different lines, walking distance to Paddington station -Location near lots of eateries and shopping including small mall -Competitive price

Reviews.Title: “Don't make our mistake”
Reviews.Author: aussieduo69
Reviews.Content: I will start with the positive, good location close to 2 tube lines. Now thats done lets get to everthing else. Room was so so hot, no air con and only a tiny sash window and a little fan. There is a hostel next door so having the window open when trying to sleep isnt really an option. We are from australia and used to the heat but the room was like a sauna that you sleep in. The room was tiny as you expect in london but the bed was in the cornor of the room which ment one person had to climb over the top of the other to get in and out. The sheets on the bed were so thin they were completely see through to the dubiously stained matress beneath. We broke out our sleeping sheets to be safe. We hade prepaid the accomadtion for 2 nights. When we checked in they put a 500 pound charge on a credit card as secuirty(more than the cost of the room). DO NOT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE STAY SOME WHERE ELSE

Reviews.Title: “Not worth ONE star!”
Reviews.Author: CanadianInGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews on this (sometimes) 3-4 star rated hotel and thought we would risk the negative comments about the lack of air conditioning because of it's proximity to Hyde Park. What a mistake. The hotel in this case was very clearly an afterthought....we walked in and immediately were presented with a tiny welcome desk covered in resident's mail (people LIVE there) and signs on the wall explaining how you have to leave deposits to have the privelage to use a hairdryer. It didn't bode well. They also insisted on a $500 deposit on the credit card....we stayed in a REAL four star hotel in Inverness the week before and nothing of the sort was required. We were given two keys and an entry code for the front door on slips of paper, then took the elevator down to the basement where it was stifling hot the moment we walked out of the elevator.
