We made our way through the dark dingy hallways to our room....which was laughable. Or would have been if we didn't have to sleep there. The bed was hard...and small. And practically IN the kitchen area. There was a cheap Ikea wardrobe and no drawers....and a small countertop ironing board with no iron. The bathroom was probably the nicest part of the whole thing and you couldn't stay in it for longer than 5 minutes at a time because it was so hot. We looked out the window and were presented with our neighbors cooking about 7 feet away. ZERO privacy. We ended up deciding to stay in London for a couple more nights and checked into a Premiere Inn...which was about a thousand times better value for the money. Even their cheapest rooms would put this place to shame. I would recommend you stay far far away from this 'hotel'.

Reviews.Title: “certainly not executive”
Reviews.Author: concertaddicts
Reviews.Content: Booked in February got put in basement where it was so hot no air con. Had to have a window open which opened onto a small courtyard and everyone used it to get from one part of building to another and everyones voices carried so loud and the fire doors banged shut continuously. Room was very small. Bed was lumpy with cheap mattress wedged against wall. We have stayed in some really nice hotels and we have stayed in some not so nice but this tops the lot. Def never going there again, def not executive at all more like YMCA but dearer. Just wanted to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs in bathroom, no air conditioning, broken shower, extremely noisey at night! beware!!”
Reviews.Author: lucy_locketx
Reviews.Content: 1) no air conditioning...even in England this is essential there wasn't even a desk or cealing fan. The window open meant the road noise kept us awake rather than the heat! 2) bugs in the broken bathroom....we had to dispose of cockroak/beetle type creatures running around the bathroon floor. The shower door didnt close properly so water got all over the floor and the toilet seat was unhinged! 3) noise levels of a night are awful...the walls are paper thin so noise from surrounding residents including Hostel next door will keep you awake if the heat and bugs dont, the type of guest we encountered here didn't seem to care what time they were keeping the whole building awake till, no awareness from the staff at all.

Reviews.Title: “Standard crap British accomidation”
Reviews.Author: DazAus
Reviews.Content: Hotel staff were very friendly but they are let down by the rooms which are too small, not cleaned even after a stay of 6 nights, towels not changed and there is such poor ventilation that you cannot sleep and the bathroom is so small it should be in the guiness book of records.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, be careful of room allocation as bed very uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: cammy7
Reviews.Content: Booked for two nights stay in these apartments. We didn't arrive till late Friday night and room was the size that we were expecting from reading previous reviews; the size of room didn't bother us. However, the bed and the heat in the room provided one of the most uncomfortable nights sleep that i have ever had (our room was on ground floor) . The next day i complained to reception about the bed and they explained that they are aware that some of the beds do need replaced and that they are in the process of doing this. They promptly found us another room on the 4th floor were the bed was much more comfortable. We were out all day Saturday (at the Stevie Wonder gig) and never arrived back into our rooms until late Saturday night, i wish i had complained about the heat as that way according to previous reviews, i would have been given a fan for the room arrrahhh!! In summation, get a room on the upper floor and ask for a fan if its very hot outside given the price and location of this room it will do just fine for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but lacks the service you'd expect from it's 'executive' description”
Reviews.Author: barmat1
Reviews.Content: We both regularly travel and stay in hotels/apartments as our jobs are field based so our interpretation of an apartment was slightly different to theirs. Having read reviews after booking I was worried but have to admit whilst the room was small it was very clean. The evenings were warm but unlike some other reviewers we simply asked reception for a fan - job done. I found the thin pillows not the mattress the most uncomfortable thing however when requested, reception gave me additional pillows. It was slightly noisy at night but not excessively so. I would say from the reviews its pot luck you either get a nice room (we did) or a shabby room. Yes the smoke alarm does go off when your making toast so open the window and fan like hell until the bread pops out!!! To summarise, its a bedroom with a microwave, sink and fridge rather than an apartment but its in a good location and feels safe. If your just looking for somewhere to lay your head then its perfectly fine just don't expect mod cons like air conditioning, a sofa or a bath - its basic

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Hell - Run as fast as you can”
Reviews.Author: cdncatlady
Reviews.Content: Booked before I read reviews. Big Mistake! I had booked a "Medium Luxury Suite". Would hate to see the next category down. This is not an "Executive" anything, and should not be called a hotel. More a short term poorly furnished apt. You get one set of towels, one tiny bar of soap and no services. Booked 4 day pre & 1 day post cruise. First 4 days - 3rd floor front. Hot, noisy & bed/pillows every bit as awful as previous reviews. Last 1 night stay - basement front room. Window looked out onto dirty steamy outside stairs (see pic). Husband sat on bed... hit the floor. Lifted mattress, slats were broken. Advised front desk 3 times.. starting at 2 pm.... when no one came we threw mattress on to fold away bed "cot" (which was also broken) someone showed up at 10 pm after we had gone to bed. Told them to go away. Had another horrible night. Very noisy (there is a hostel 2 doors down, noise and partying all night). I didn't see any cockroaches, but I wouldn't have been surprised. My only positive comment on this place is it's location is very close to Hyde Park. Wouldn't wish this place on my worst enemy. Run people Run!!!

Reviews.Title: “An excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: Dottee1960
Reviews.Content: My daughter and myself arrived on Saturday 22nd May 2010 and had a warm welcome by the receptionist. Booking in was not a problem and was quick and painless. This particular day was the start of the first heatwave of the year, so the first night was very hot and uncomfortable for someone used to the cold weather in Scotland, but that was not the fault of the hotel, they did provide a fan which was on all the time. The room was big enough for our needs, the bed was very comfortable, but could have done with an extra pillow. Having the fridge was a god send with the heatwave and gave us the opportunity to keep all our food and water chilled. We had a good nights sleep every night and was surprised how quiet it was at night and during the day. There are 2 tube stations just around the corner, every amenitiy you could ask for in Queensway including restaurants, cinema, convenience stores and souvenier shops. Hyde Park was just at the bottom of the road what else could you ask for. We stayed for 5 nights in this modern clean apartment hotel and will be booking in again on our next visit. The reviews we read after booking this hotel made us wonder if we had made the right decision to book...all our fears were quickly dismissed and we had a very pleasant stay. We were not troubled with noise from other residents or smoke detectors going off, the corridors were kept clear and we checked the fire escape route, that was well marked and followed it down to the fire exit at the front of the hotel (Which is something I always check in every hotel I stay in, as I like to know that myself and my family can escape in an event of a fire...everyone should do this, ask any fireman). I would highly recommend Hyde Park Executive Apartments as a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value if you like preparing your own meals”
Reviews.Author: kart
Reviews.Content: We paid 70GBP per night for a room with a kitchenette, in the heart of the Queensway/Bayswater area - what terrific value! Yes the room was small, but it was clean and perfectly adequate, modern and well-designed. We didn't feel cramped and loved that we could cook our own breakfasts or heat-up a take-away lunch or dinner. The kitchenette had everything you'd want - from pots & plates to a toaster and microwave and stove. Even dish cloths and dishwashing liquid and brushes. There's no aircon though, so it might be a problem if it gets hot. Luckily for us, it was cold so this wasn't a problem. We were lucky enough to be able to access the hotel's free WiFi from our room - I saw some people had to go to the lobby to access it. Location was terrific too - easily walkable to Bayswater and Queensway Tube stations. Queensway (the road) has lots of shops, restaurants etc that stay open quite late, and a Tesco Express is just around the corner from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: tiffer65
Reviews.Content: The entrance reception was clean and bright and the receptionist very attentive. Although we had 2 basement apartments they were large, very clean and suited our needs. Excellent en-suite with plenty of hot water. Although it was very noisy we were staying in central London so didn't expect anything else. Would thoroughly recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “nice place if you booked medium size room”
Reviews.Author: izmir35
Reviews.Content: Standarts rooms are small. If you stay in London you cant find big room. Location is great.Just 1 minute to Hyde Park. Also to 2 tube station.Bayswater and Queensway. Beds are small. And they haven't twin bed. Just double but seems like a normal bed :) You should buy extra bed if you travelling with your friend...

Reviews.Title: “Absolutally repulsive, NEVER GO HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Scientist1223
Reviews.Content: Once I finally found my room, in which seemed to be a maze where the corridor lights did not even work, so my partner and I had to wander aimlessly in the dark; my first impression of the room was that it was tiny, there is no way in hell I would ever class it as an apartment, it was a joke. And to say that it contained a fully equipped kitchenette was laughable, we had one plate, one glass and a few spoons. The bathroom was the size of a postage stamp and swelteringly hot, and the heater was unadjustable. One of the shower doors was entirely missing and one of the floor tiles cracked. The shelf under the mirror collapsed under the weight of a few shampoo bottles. The toilet had stains of the last occupant in it and there were nail clippings on the floor. I doubt the room was even cleaned at all before our arrival. After going out for the evening, on our way back through the maze of corridors I saw a cockroach crawl out from under one room door and go under another one, it was disgusting. Once back at the room I realised that I was certainly not going to get any sleep as soon as I laid in bed. The sheets were dirty and stained with what looked likespots of blood, and the mattress was possibly the most uncomfortable mattress in the world, my neck is still stiff. The walls were paper thin, and I could hear our neighbours getting busy throughout the night. I was woken up several times in the morning by other rooms smoke alarms going off, which I later found out was by the toasters. The room was so hot, and the only window we had opened to a walk over bridge between two of the corridors, where anyone could have climbed in, I did not feel safe in the slightest. All in all, the hotel was filthy, noisy, unfriendly and frankly, a repulsive disappointment and complete waste of money. I will certainly never return to this joke of an establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Small Beds and Cockroaches”
Reviews.Author: randy785
Reviews.Content: I took my Girlfriend to this hotel for a weekend break. first impressions were good! great location and friendly staff. The room was of a good standerd modern and a great shower. the beds were terible very small and very uncomfortable.when we awoke in the morning found that there was about 5 cockroaches struting around the room, Bit of a passion killer for my Girlfriend! When leaving the room hotels usually let you leave your bags there whilst you browse the city before you leave but this hotel charged Â£5 per bag which really is poor!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean, cheap and excellent staff - shame about the beds!”
Reviews.Author: ohirome
Reviews.Content: We decided to book a 3 day stay here due to the location, having previously stayed in and loved Bayswater, as well as the price and nature of the 'apartments'. We noticed some negative reviews and were a little hesitant, however upon arriving we were checked in 3 hours early and were put in a large, bright and super clean room. Everything was tip top, the bathroom was spotless and we had fresh towels - lovely stuff! Our only real negative point would be the mattresses. I can easily say they were the worst ive ever experienced. You would think that after spending so much on the finishings they'd go that extra step and get some great mattresses...sadly not. It didnt spoil the trip and we'd consider coming back, however since the bedding issue seems to be quite popular on here, hopefully management will get it rectified by the time we come back! I would also like to thank the wonderful manager/receptionist who was happy to check us in early and always greeted us with a smile. Many thanks!

Reviews.Title: “lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: leonie_lewis
Reviews.Content: me and my partner did a package deal with last minute.com for are anniversary on the 19th march. we chose to stay in the executive suite which was a lovely spacious room on the 2nd floor. all the rooms are different sizes so its best checking before you book. in the appartment there was two double beds (i ddnt knw why) a kitchen area and ensuite bathroom plenty of room to relax and breathe the stresses away. we also went to see chicago at the theatre and the staff was so kind to give us directions. would highly recommend for a romantic weekend break. thank you for making are stay memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: MisterStudent
Reviews.Content: Personally, i had a great stay the room was clean and very nice for the price. Well furnished had everything i needed apart from the internet [which is free] but we were suited in the basement. [If you want the internet, i suggest you ask for first floor in advance] Transport is great, train station is just around the corner and it's very near a busy high-street with all the main shops you would want. Highly Recommend for couples having a city break and those looking for a short stay, not sure if it will be suitable for families.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate but certainly not impressive”
Reviews.Author: ascivious
Reviews.Content: Took my wife on a weekend trip in Mar 2010 and stayed here. The room was extremely small. Crammed in it was a bed, a chair, a bar/counter top, refrigerator, sink, and a bathroom. There was not much room to even sit luggage down on the floor. I expected it to be small being in London but this was much smaller than I anticipated. I have stayed in Rome, Paris, and Venice all with bigger rooms than this one. My wife and I could not be in the bathroom at the same time because it was so small. We noticed no noise problems though. The staff barely spoke English, which is odd being in London and all. They did have an iron and ironing board in the room which was handy. It was close to two different underground stops, less than 5 mins walk to each (Bayswater on the Circle and District Line and Queensway on the Central Line). Nearby there was a Starbucks, a McDonalds, and several other cafes/restaurants and other various shops. Also a pretty good bar nearby, the Black Lion where they have Hoegaarden (my favorite beer) on tap. The last thing to mention which sort of infuriated me is that the hotel charged a 3% fee on using a credit card to pay for the room. Charging a fee to use a credit card? Get with the 21st century. That was ridiculous and is not mentioned whatsoever on their website, nor booking.com where I made the reservation. Overall, it is not a horrible place to stay but I would not stay there again and it certainly did not live up to the 4 star rating it had.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Ear Plugs!”
Reviews.Author: BritLib
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom apartment last week. It was clean and decent size. However, we were adjacent to the front door which did not close quietly! In the evenings, door was slammed every 5 or 10 minutes and this went on until late at night. The walls are thin at best - probably made out of recycled Kleenex. In fact a person who was in a room below us came up to complain about noise even though we were walking about normally. If you like peace and quiet do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “hmmm.. great location.. but....”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie72
Reviews.Content: ...... I don't think I would stay there again. Was just browsing where to stay near Hyde Park this June - and this place kept popping up! Stayed there last year whilst on a budget break - on the plus side - great location - brilliant for Paddington Station and literally one minute to the Park. On the minus - most uncomfortbale bed in the world! Felt like a piece of board. Teeny bathroom. Quite noisy and didn't feel that secure. I guess each apartment is different - but I think I'd pay a bit more for a good night's sleep! On the minus

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: choco43
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in the hyde park executive apartment for valentines day and found it amazing! Only complaints were that the room was abit small, the microwave cover didnt look like it had been washed and the bed was a bit hard but other than that it was luvli. The bathroom was sooo beautiful i absolutely loved the place and will definately go back. I recommend it to everyone xxx

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic bargain for central London”
Reviews.Author: kaylz86
Reviews.Content: Booked the Hyde Park Executive Apartments after reading the reviews. Some of the reviews made me worry, however on arrival I knew we'd made the right choice to book. Arrived to a polite receptionist who provided us with a room on the 4th floor (I asked for a high floor and they were happy to oblige). In the room I was a little shocked of the size of the room, not that it was to small by any means however we'd paid for the Superier because people had mentioned the rooms being small, however it didn't seem superier to us. In the description it said we'd have an arm chair and coffee table, so I assumed they'd give us the wrong room. We asked reception who confirmed that we did have a superier room, and that they'd put a arm chair and coffee table in the room soon!! However, the man arrived and could not fit the arm chair through the door....even if he did then Im sure it would have taken up all of the space. So we didn't get the chair, I presume either they didn't have any superier rooms left and so tried to pretent ours was or it was, which means the standard rooms must be tiny. It was only an extra Â£10 from standard to superier so we didn't mind to much. Who knows if we got the right room or not?? Anyway. The room was very clean, with a kitchen area, breakfast bar and two stools which we sat at to have a drink and chat. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom an ample size. It did get very warm through the night, however we just slept with the blanket off and were fine. I love going to London and would highly recommend these apartments to stay ,very good location. Main high street has restaurants and pubs and close to Queensway Tube. For the price these apartments are perfect...I have paid much more in London before for must less :-)

Reviews.Title: “Bayeswater London”
Reviews.Author: wiccan1981
Reviews.Content: This place was real good. The Staff were real nice, we arrived a bit before the actual check-in time, and they had a room ready for us to sign for. This Hotel is close to 2 different Underground Stations as well as many food places. We were just a couple minutes walk from Whitely's, as that was a plus, for we were going there to meet friends.

Reviews.Title: “Not really an apartment - more like a bed-sit”
Reviews.Author: grandmatrees
Reviews.Content: To describe this accommodation as an apartment is a gross exagerration. Further description double de-luxe is an insult to anyones intelligence. The "fully equipped kitchenette" had one dessert spoon, one knife one mug and one large plate. I had to resort to eating my cereal with a teaspoon!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant brilliant brilliant!”
Reviews.Author: Bl0ndie2010
Reviews.Content: This is my first TripAdvisor review even though I use the site before I ever book anywhere. I just had to write on here as I couldn't believe all the bad hype about this place... So, not really sure where some of the other moaning reviewers were staying but both myself and my boyfriend thought the apartments were perfect. I have high standards to say the least but was a little short on cash after Christmas so thought i'd book up a night at the Hyde Park Apartments as we needed a place to stay. For Â£65 I didn't expect the apartments to be 'Executive' (unlike many of the previous reviewers!) but I honestly couldn't complain about anything. Literally a 2 minute walk from Queensway and Bayswater tube station and right on Hyde Park so the location couldn't be better. I'm not sure what the receptionists name was but he was brilliant. Considering there are over 100 rooms in the building, he remembered us by room number everytime we had any dealings with him and was really helpful. We arrived at about midday and our room was ready. After reading the previous reviews, I had a vision of it smelling, being dirty, having uncomfortable beds and being generally like a hostel. But we opened the door and I was completely relieved. The room was so clean, it didn't smell, everything looked like it was brand new, the bed was lovely, the bathroom was gorgeous.. I could go on and on! We didn't really make use of the kitchen as we ate out but everything seemed great. We were told that they were replacing all of the mattresses so in response to all the reviewees that weren't happy with the beds, at least management are doing something about it! Overall, it was everything and so much more that we needed. I just can't believe that for Â£65, in central London, in a really lovely place, people are still moaning! We'll definitely be staying here again and again!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a nice surprise! New Mattresses!”
Reviews.Author: flekiboy
Reviews.Content: I travelled to this property a bit concerned due to certain reviews regarding the bad quality of the mattreses, however I was pleasantly surprised when I saw a big truck arriving with new mattresses! there must have been about 50 or 60 mattreses delivered. I must say that the place is really new, and location couldn't be any better ( very close to two tube stations and hyde park). we were out most of the day walking a lot, so it was great to be able to sleep on a new comfortable mattress at night, as that was our main concern based on previous comments. Once this problem seems to have been sorted I would definitely recommend this place as the value for money is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE-AWFUL.”
Reviews.Author: SebastianBaron
Reviews.Content: I would not recomend this place to anyone. Tiny rooms, awful noise during the night. This place its like a youth hostel. They are liars when they say that this place are apartments.

Reviews.Title: “Bloody awfull - not 3/4 star -- its more 0*”
Reviews.Author: nursemanager
Reviews.Content: At present staying at this bloody awfull apartment - you cant even swing a cat for the price. Its just a pity that we have already paid the place thru lastminute.com and to try to get in touch with lastminute.com is a waste of time and at the same time you are out off pocket waiting for a human being to talk to you (I have wasted Â£20.00 holding on the other end!). 30mins after checking we requested for an extra cup/mug and pillows but 6hrs later these 2 items were still not in the room. On the 3rd request -- a man called TONY from the reception was very rude and replied that he will deliver these items as soon as it takes and this is supposed to be LONDON. We were recently in CAMBODIA and for a 3rd world country their service and the accomodation is far better than this place and they call this place HYDE PARK EXECUTIVE APARTMENT!!! I think they should change their name to HYDE PARK FROM HELL APARTMENT.-- this place should be condenm and staff should go back to school and learn to have manners!! Future visitors please beware!!

Reviews.Title: “I would say most valuable on Bayswater.”
Reviews.Author: nickjtan
Reviews.Content: This is not your everyday hotel, its more like an service apartment. The rooms are small but can be considered big compare to many of the other hotels on the same row, you're in London, how big can the room get? The reception staff are really friendly and the is free wireless in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as the pictures look!!”
Reviews.Author: NicholaCassidy
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the apartments having booked an executive studio apartment through Hoseasons. The street where the apartments are is lovely and a minutes walk to Hyde Park. Check in was relatively easy although only one set of keys were available and we were a party of 4 so not very convenient. Told our room was in the basement and sent to find it. After working our way through the maze of rooms we realised that we had to cross an outdoor courtyard to get to our room. To say we were disappointed was an understatement!! The room had one double bed, one pull out bed a small kitchen and the bathroom. There was no table to sit at or a sofa so the apartment was quite useless to us we might as well have stayed in a hotel!! Of the 9 lights in the ceiling only 4 were working, there were 4 quests staying in the room yet only 2 or 3 cups, glasses, plates, bowls and cutlery and not a single wine glass! No means of cleaning up were supplied, we broke a glass and couldn't even sweep it up! Not good enough in my eyes! I spoke to the manager about the room and asked to be moved and was told that was what I had paid for so that is what I got. Staff not helpful at all. We could not use this apartment apart from to sleep in which is not the point of booking an apartment. Really disappointed was offered alternative accommodation on the other side of London but decided to stay as we had researched the area. I would not recommend this accommodation!

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms”
Reviews.Author: Liv828
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here. My first stay was better in 2007, when it was newly opened. If u r looking for clean, decent rooms near the tube, this is not too bad. The rooms are ok size with a fridge, microwave and hot plate cooking stove. There is no room service at all. They only clean your room once upon check in and only if u stay for more than a week. Overall, it was an ok stay for me but they definately need to change the beds. It is very uncomfortable and please ask for rooms which r not facing the main road, super noisy.

Reviews.Title: “Not as bad as others found it!”
Reviews.Author: redkerr15
Reviews.Content: So....with much fear after reading reviews on this place my friend and I ventured to this hotel for a two night stay. We had booked a while ago (the most recent reviews were really bad!). On arrival yes I had to hand over a card. But the guy at the desk was courteous enough and I couldn't be bothered making a fuss. I have stayed in far worse places than this. We never found the staff rude at all! The room was very clean, spacious enough with a fridge, little cooker and microwave. The bed admittedly wasn't the best but after two days trekking round London we slept well. The location is fab! Both Bayswater and Queensway are so close. The road these stations are on are packed with restaurants. I have to say visit Cafe Roma for breakfast, this little gem can be found on the way to the underground if you go right out of the hotel. Bus stop round the corner can get you to Oxford Street and Victoria Station. In a nutshell, if you want luxury, pay for it! If you want a decent budget hotel in a good location, this is fine!

Reviews.Title: “oh gosh jus a visit wos bad enough let alone stay one night!”
Reviews.Author: bbmuimui
Reviews.Content: i visited the hyde park todai just to view it before i booked it to save money LUCKILY i did view it not book it! .. staff was VERY RUDE! the lady soooooooooooooooooooooooooo RUDE! unbelievable, the rooms were terrible, thats right underground. jus a small boxed room and a small toilet.. so tiny.. felt isolated.. ! would not recommend. im gna look for something bterr!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel,excellent service, excellent location couldnt ask for more.”
Reviews.Author: maccy87
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 2night trip in london and stayed in Hyde Park Executive Apartments. was a little scared as reviews werent that great! they were amazing rooms for the price your paying, great value. when we arrived, we were given one of the standard rooms, with a double bed. it was really spacious and had great amenties, but as we left the room, we found that the lock to our door was dodgy, so we informed reception and they moved us to another room asap! they also upgraded us to a bigger more spacious room as a result, where we had 2 double beds. we were very happy. the beds arnt the greatest, but nevertheless, i slept fine on them!! Top marks for services here. Definetly would come back and recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Executive Apartments? I don't even know where to start...”
Reviews.Author: turnleftguides
Reviews.Content: I have just checked out a few hours ago, I never write hotel reviews but I feel compelled to tell you a bit more about this place and to get it out of my system. First of all the name of the place is ludicrous: Hyde Park Executive Apartments, who are they kidding! It's certainly round the corner from Kensington Gardens and the Bayswater location is outstanding for Notting Hill, the West End and the City but these are certainly not apartments - more like bedsits with kitchenettes - and there's nothing remotely executive about the place - it's not just understaffed, it's not even staffed at all... Having said that it was "only" Â£70 a night, arguably a bargain in central London. It's probably the worst bed I've ever stayed in, and that includes years of backpacking in Asia and South America, and stays at the infamous mansions in Hong Kong. I've had a stiff back & shoulders the whole week. The bed is tiny as well in width but also in length (I'm only 5'11'' - it's not like I'm 6'4"). What's described as a flat screen LCD TV is suspended over the bed like a CCTV camera and without a remote control. Insulation is really poor and I could hear my neighbours going to the toilets at 2am. Quite gross. There was an unpleasant smell coming from the bathroom (apart from that the bathroom was the best feature of the room). Surely calling it Apartments is the best excuse for the absence of reception and room service. The guy at check in was chatting to his mates during 2 minutes before he took notice of my presence. I had to produce a piece of ID upon check-in (luckily I'm French - the UK has no official ID). And I was appalled that I had to agree to a Â£500 guarantee on my credit card. I had to write my card number on a piece of paper and I was just assured this morning that the piece of paper would be discarded. Now I will check my bank account every week to make sure that they don't overcharge me. I certainly wouldn't recommend this place to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Apartments? would not say so”
Reviews.Author: Tree69
Reviews.Content: How can you sell rooms underground! Rooms are all white, impersonal, and not clean. And beware, you are sleeping with your neighbors, first time I have seen such a bad insulation. Not to be recommended.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic location, great value for where it is”
Reviews.Author: chloerickard
Reviews.Content: intended for long-stay (theres a microwave and fridge etc), the bed was a little uncomfy but that much space in that location, for that price?! amazing.

Reviews.Title: “certainly not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: bexkymusic
Reviews.Content: If you think you're booking a decent sized 4* apartment, let's just say you get what you pay for. Good location, clean rooms, however.....our room was positively tiny and the double bed was more like an oversized single. There was also no where to store our suitcases. So, if you think you're getting a bargain '4* executive apartment', think again- it's more of a postage stamp like space with a kitchen sink!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: ShoesandBags
Reviews.Content: Perfect short stay as location is just around the corner from Kensington Park and only a short walk to tube station. Was a bit put off with other negative comments about the beds but we found it comfortable enough. Everything was very clean and nothing really to complain about apart from extra pillows and no hair dryer! Our room was a nice size and although we were next to a youth hostel, noise level didn't bother us at all. I would definately book this apartment again!

Reviews.Title: “Something less than was expected”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Faulkner
Reviews.Content: This was a massive disappointment for a number of reasons. First off, this place was advertised specifically as an apartment, and it was encouraging to walk to the front thinking it looks absolute class. Once opening the room, I felt entitled to expect a bit more than just a room with virtually no space to relax, the double bed taking up the large percentage of the room and nowhere to sit other than two fairly uncomfortable bar stools. The ironing board was a complete joke and almost unusable. There was no hairdryer available for the room and we had to specifically request it., which is unacceptable by the standard of most modern hotel rooms, let alone a supposedly serviced apartment. The wardrobe had three coathangers. The crockery amounted to a milk pan and a frying pan and the icing on the cake was when attempting to cook breakfast in the morning, the toaster managed to set off the smoke detector which is cleverly positioned adjacent to the hobs. We could also hear the smoke detector going off in other adjacent rooms too. The doors hardly close quietly so you can hear just about everything going on. A plasma TV was advertised, it was pinned in above the bed with the reality being analogue service with four channels not even corresponding to the remote control. Thank god we brought an I-Pod station. The room was not even serviced once and the towels/bedding were not changed once throughout the stay. The shower was barely enough to swing a cat in and the basin for the bathroom tiny. I will also add the lifts seem to take for ever to get from one floor to the next, and the corridors are about 60 degrees celsius so always have your window open and fans switched on. On the positive side, its brilliantly located for the tube stations and various amenities, but that's hardly a credit to the place itself. In my view they are quite fortunate to have other facilities in close proximity, without which this is something I couldn't even come close to recommending it. We may have got a much smaller room than others that may exist, and I'd recommend it only if you are utterly desperate just for somewhere to sleep and sleep only, but for the Â£190 we paid for two nights, I'd want a bit more and advise that if that's the summit of what you want, try and find a hostel or similar. To try and call something like this an apartment is a joke - its more like a hotel minus breakfast or anything resembling room service. I had a fantastic weekend in London, but I have little reason to thank this nadir of a place.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we were looking for”
Reviews.Author: AnneSiegler
Reviews.Content: We were looking for something simple and inexpensive for our honeymoon. We live in a big city and wanted to feel as if we were living in London for a week. This place definitely gave us that feeling. We didn't mind that the room didn't get cleaned or the towels switched out while we were there. It was worth the money we saved and better for the environment. The size was perfect. Our view out the window wasn't spectacular, but it didn't matter because all we needed to do in the room was shower and sleep. The kitchenette was an added bonus that allowed us to keep milk in the fridge and eat cereal and a banana every morning to save money. We got the deluxe room with a double bed. It was not a high quality bed but we both slept perfectly fine. The entire place was furnished in Ikea. The place was extremely clean. We liked that there was free wirelss internet in the lobby and we actually got the signal in our room as well. The staff was so friendly. We liked how we had the feeling we were in our own apartment in the city, coming and going without much fuss. The location was excellent! We used the underground for all our transportation and everything was a short ride away. Hyde Park is walking distance which was nice. There is a Tesco and Post Office right nearby. Air conditioning might have been nice but we don't have it back at home in Chicago so we didn't mind. I highly recommend this to anyone looking for an affordable place to stay in London with privacy and clean facilities. If you are looking for someone to clean up after you every day while you sit in your room and stare out the window and sleep all day, this is not the place for you. (My 50-something parents might not have been so comfortable on the bed.)

Reviews.Title: “Stay clear of this shack.”
Reviews.Author: ashling555
Reviews.Content: would not reccommend this place to anyone. room was tiny. blown bulbs in bedroom and bathroom. broken tile in bathroom which i cut my toe on. very very dirty - walls, floors. Staying there for 6 nights and there wasn't even a chair to sit down on - the whole reason we booked an apartment. Surely when your in that business you should know when someone is staying for 6 nights they need a resonably comfortable room. we stayed on 3rd floor. 3 evenings we came back the lift was broken so we had to use the stairs, not good- hallways and stairways were so hot with no windows, vents etc. and definately no aircon. sweltering heat. internet only in lobby and even at that its only wireless and very hard to connect. cost us Â£485 for 6 nights which was an absolute joke. will not be staying there again. and i was as good as told the reason room was so bad was because i booked it through centralr.com. and not directly through them.

Reviews.Title: “Small Uncomfortable Apartments”
Reviews.Author: TomySomerset
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my partner for 6 nights and when I booked the accommodation was described as 4* Deluxe Double Room. This description was very misleading as the service provided was far from 4* and the room was certainly not Deluxe. The apartments are only serviced once per week so you had to ask for additional clean towels and toilet paper. We had to change rooms after the first night as the mattress was the most uncomfortable we had ever slept on as we could feel the hard springs all over our bodies. The bed in the second room was marginally better but being on the front of the hotel very noisy at night. This was not from traffic but from a nearby hostel where sad youths seemed to spend all night (at least until 3 am) talking and yelling to each other. There was no air conditioning so it was a choice of suffering the noise or being stifled by heat and lack of air. We would definitely not stop in this hotel again or indeed this area of London where 90% of hotels are inferior to the description under which they are sold. â€ƒ

Reviews.Title: “It's an apartment not a hotel”
Reviews.Author: geekaart
Reviews.Content: My wife and I arrived during the heat wave at the end of June. Arriving Saturday afternoon, it was hot and we suffered through one night heat was our first impression of London and Hyde Park Apartment. The staff were great, personable, courteous and helped when they could. Our room was supposed to have a remote for the TV. When we inquired, the front desk person said someone must have taken it and he would have to buy one. Being on the weekend, we didn't pursue the matter but the remote didn't show up over our week stay. However, with only 3 channels available (not satellite - just basic cable), there really wasn't a need. We picked the smaller double room: double bed, large closet, small kitchenette and bath. The window over looked the street. For us, it was comfortable. We were prepared for smaller rooms coming from Canada. We also didn't have much luggage and was on a budget so the size was exactly what we expected. During the heatwave, if not for the fan we got on Monday, we would have switched rooms. There was a room across from ours that overlooked the alley. Not a great view but likely a little more quiet and more spacious. It was a double room, furniture was the same size but floor space was twice as wide. Two windows so you could keep the open at night and not hear the noise from the street. The bed was comfortable, although we slept on the duvet and used the extra large towels for bedding due to the heat. If not for the fan we got on Monday, I would have paid a little more and switched rooms for one facing the alley. The bathroom was a good size but the shower was quite small even for me. Iâ€™m about 5â€™8 and bending down was difficult. Others have posted pictures and itâ€™s evident. The doors have two locks. Great for us as the top bolt did not work properly and never did get fixed. Positives: Good location - 2 minutes from Hyde Park (beautiful), a block away from Queensway and Bayswater metro station, a block from all restaurants, grocery store and mall. Well stocked kitchenette - enough dishes & pots to make your own meals. But with so many good restaurants, itâ€™s mostly heating up leftovers. Clean â€“ when we arrived. Room service on the weekends only but extra towels and toiletries available if needed. Free Wi-Fi â€“ best down at the reception desk but we found our connection on the third floor good enough for web email and basic surfing. Perhaps because our room was directly over the front desk on the third floor. Not sure but saved the trouble of having to go down to the lobby. Washer + Dryer â€“ coin operated available Elevator â€“ especially if on the upper floors and have luggage Negatives: Noisy â€“ Inverness (street) has many other apartments/hotels/hostels and close to busy streets. On the weekends and most nights, hostel crowd/friends were up fairly late and loud. Would have been better if the window was closed but due to the heat we left the window open. Not too much street traffic though. Location â€“ a little far from central London. But if you get a tourist pass, the tube will take you everywhere. Apartment â€“ this is not a hotel. So youâ€™re room wonâ€™t be cleaned daily, not safety deposit box, usually one staff on site, Access â€“ only one key per room. Not great if you want to do your own thing even if itâ€™s the two of you. The front entrance is locked all the time but at least there is someone at the front desk to let you in for most of the day. Overall a good stay for those that do not need pampering, need a bed to sleep, basic amenities and the flexibility of a kitchenette. Would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “bed fit for a child”
Reviews.Author: christina08
Reviews.Content: i compleaty understand what people are saying when they say the size of the apartment. it is tiny. thats the best word for it. its a tiny stuffy studio "apartment" with no room to breath let alone walk around. you walk in the door, 2 steps and thats it. first of all, it was very clean. thats all that was good really. stayed for 3 nights and not once were the towells replaced. we even had to buy more toilet paper as the hotel reception kept ignoring our request. this was the same for the towells. the bed was a big single and there was no hair dryer!!!!!! madness. it really fools you on the website calling them luxury. the area looks quite nice but the buildings surrounding are actually all hostels full of rowdy students hanging around all the time!!!! the area does seem a bit scary but it is so close to everything so it didnt bother us too much. all in all, i would not return here again stay in a proper hotel, where service is actually provided and where everyone doesnt literally look at u like u have 6 heads each time u walk into the main reception area. it was so annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Surprise.”
Reviews.Author: SunLovingChick
Reviews.Content: Wasnt expecting much as paid a low price on lasminute.com But was lovely, very fresh and clean, immaculate bathroom Helpful staff Lovely kitchen area, very well equipped. Excellent location. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “nothing 'executive' about this place!”
Reviews.Author: shoppaholic33
Reviews.Content: After looking at the name of the hotel I was quite excited, however once we opened the door to the apartment (If you can call it that, it should be more appopriately name a room with a small kitchen!) after walking across slippery glass walkways to our room, we were somewhat disappointed. We walked into a small very stuffy room. There were food stains on the duvet cover and mould in the bathroom. The only good thing about our stay was the location, only about ten minutes walk from the tube but for me that was the only good thing about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you really just want a bed for the night”
Reviews.Author: KatePe
Reviews.Content: We booked here to stay for 4 nights at the start of a month long trip. It was good value for money and the pictures looked nice on the website. When we arrived it was impressive from the outside and the reception area was lovely. From there on we were disappointed. We booked a deluxe room - they tried to put us in the basement to start with. The room was right next to a drain that was pouring with water and felt like we were in a dungeon. They were happy to show us another room but this one was not much better. We were 2 friends travelling together and knew we were going to be sharing a bed which was fine, except when we saw the bed and it was barely bigger than a single. The room was very sterile - all white and the floors outside the room creaked whenever someone walked past. We ended up only lasting 2 nights here (they refunded us for one night but charged us for the other night) as we got so sick there was no way we could sleep in the tiny bed. The only positive was the excellent location - right opposite Hyde Park, walking distance to Notting Hill, Portabello market and Oxford St and close to Tube stations. Would be OK if you really were only planning to sleep here and not sharing a bed.

Reviews.Title: “I would never recommend this place”
Reviews.Author: Katiedidd40
Reviews.Content: The location is good as it is within a few minutes walk to two tubes and bus stops nearby. No AC and we begged for a fan...no luck. There are no wash cloths to clean the kitchenette OR in the bathroom. Towels are NOT replaced. There was no coffee pot provided either. No blow dryer and if you want to fix your hair, you have to rely on the reflection of the microwave as a mirror. No place tt other than a bar stool or the bed...which is horrible. We could feel the springs in the mattress and it is so short your feet hit the footboard. The floor was dirty and if barefoot our feet were black. The staff was friendly and you can leave your bags before/after check in/out for a 5 pound charge. I will say I was surprised when we picked up our bags, there was no checking if they were indeed our bags. If you plan on a trip in the summer heat, and plan on spending anytime during the day in your room, this is not the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hmmmmmmmmm strangely enjoyable stay if improvisation is your idea of fun”
Reviews.Author: fenrotherwitch
Reviews.Content: Arrived at apartments 25th June mid afternoon, having booked via internet in March (before consulting TripAdvisor.) 15 minutes to check in as a polite receptionist juggled phone, staff queries and customers. Went through checkin with hiccup of not having photo ID despite having printed e mail confirmation of booking and living in the UK but as we had card used to make booking we were allowed to pay up front for three nights. Then told that only rooms left were on ground and lower ground floor, but "thats probably for the best as it is hot" Went down in lift to the room. which was pretty much as expected. The bathroom though small was clean and modern bathsheets and handtowels provided. 5 of the ceiling lights were not working which in a basement is unfortunate. so I raised the roller blind to survey the view. A small grey yard about 12 foot square with three other windows looking over it and two doors leading through it. If you raised the window and stuck your head out you and looked up about 20 feet above you could see a railing edging the street behind the property.....stunning. It also had the advantage that the two doors were used as a route between the adjoining houses so if the blind was raised people wandering through could wave at you. My husband asked to see another room and returned to say this one on the ground floor was further disadvanted by having the bed in an alcove so that to get in or out you had to climb over the end of the bed. Our room had one side free of the wall at least. So we settled for what we had. We manhandled the bed away from the wall it was on so that I didnt have to climb over him to get out of bed, and I sent him searching for a hairdryer as none were provided in the room. He returned with one from reception that had seen better days which I held onto for the three days as dripping up there everytime I wanted to dry my hair seemed ridiculous. After an excellent shower I dried my hair using the microwave door as a mirror as no mirror except in the bathroom. Obviously executives have no hair! Once we had got used to living underground we realised we were lucky as we didn't suffer the street noise that other rooms did and we could open our windows fully when we were in the room and awake, though we were not so keen to risk this at night with the access route running past. I took the mattress off and relocated the two slats that had come out and after the this the bed was quite comfortable though the mattress was a real cheapy. It was so hot when we stayed that I don't think anything but aircon would have worked though a fan might have been useful. All this having been said we had a good stay and this was because of its brilliant location. Take the word executive out of the name and expectations might be more realistic.

Reviews.Title: “Take the "executive" off the name”
Reviews.Author: NapoleonXVI
Reviews.Content: =Accommodation: A sinking double bed, a large window opening to the street and some modern kitchen furniture in a compact but rather well laid-out whole. But the room was also rather chilly, partly because the window was fully open at the time of arrival, but at least it had been closed by the time I arrived back at the room later that evening, although I still had to go down to hunt for a duvet which was not present. With luck the desk clerk was able to find one, but that was a strange oversight in the first place. Even more disturbing (along with such local idiosyncracies like the need to lock the door with the key after closing it -- at least nothing became unaccounted for...) was the loosely clanging door between this and the room next door, which of course did nothing to improve the already non-existent soundproofing between the rooms. The bathroom and room itself were spotless and with a more modern, Scandinavian touch, but with the temperature inside both also more akin to Swedish Lapland in autumn (without mosquitoes). For the hotel's somewhat demanding name, as well as for the price -- although far from especially expensive for London, but nevertheless the most expensive in my whole trip -- one might be tempted to expect a bit more than was the case. =Location: Rather nice, just off Hyde Park and with excellent connections to surface and sub-surface transport. Along a picturesque colonnaded terrace that can also make finding the hotel a bit difficult the first time. =Other: Steel-encased elevator (nice) and the infuriating motion controlled, automatically-turning-off corridor lighting (not nice). No complimentary refreshments (along the accommodation concept). =Personnel: Friendly and helpful young personnel, which nevertheless could do only so much to overcome some of the oversights. =Verdict: No-frills living quarters with the back-packer-friendly kitchenette amenities -- a somewhat chilly experience in a modernly decorated but dubiously soundproofed double.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, poor facilities, excessive extra charges etc, poor service.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew92
Reviews.Content: The name of the place is of course ridiculous, but the lcoation is great and the rooms are fine and have a nice modern feel abou them. The beds are rubbish, the cooking equipment is laughable, and the last couple of times I stayed there I have found too many other peoples' hairs lying around on the floor. But my main gripes are the attempt to get photographic ID off you when you arrive (the place is Spanish run, but they need to adjust to the UK) and the requirement to give a credit card agreement to the tune of Â£500 for any damage you cause - totally excessive. Then it'll cost you Â£6 a day for internet connection and another Â£6 if you want to leave anything in the baggage room. The reception is also understaffed so it'll take you forever to check in etc. I won't be putting myself through this again.

Reviews.Title: “No Air-con”
Reviews.Author: dirtmay
Reviews.Content: Do not stay in this hotel if the weather forecast is hot and sunny. There is no air-con, making the rooms unbearably hot. It was cooler outside than in. Rooms are basic, there are cooking facilities, but there is no way they could used due to the heat. The location is good. They're close enough if you want to go Oxford Street etc, but far enough away to have a chilled afternoon at a local boozer/cafe.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, HORRIBLE BED!”
Reviews.Author: goodtimes88
Reviews.Content: There seems to be a consensus about this place that I totally agree with. Unfortunately I read the reviews after booking but couldn't really do much by then. Strangely I left feeling happy to have been there but I think thats mainly down to the location and the time I had during the trip. Right off bayswater station, next to Hyde Park, everything around that you'd need and on the circle line. Can't complain. The bathroom was very clean too. Other than that not great. The room was small and stuffy in the hot weather. I agree with other reviewers that the floor would have been more comfortable than the mattress, it really was horrendous to sleep on!! Springs everywhere, one pillow, too short. The fact that its an 'apartment' with a kitchen really is more of a gimmick than anything else. If you're staying less than a week then I'd just go for a normal hotel room...we only ended up using the fridge. And as we discovered when we got there...the extra money paid for a "deluxe" room simply kept us from being in the basement or first floor!

Reviews.Title: “Unappealing cross between a Travelodge and a bedsit”
Reviews.Author: Reviewer2009x
Reviews.Content: Good location but small, unwelcoming rooms with thin walls, tiny and uncomfortable mattresses together with suspect cleanliness. Only "executive" if you normally live in a shed. Even though only paid Â£90/night, it was entirely unimpressive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: emwil
Reviews.Content: We stayed in these apartments for 2 nights this week and thought they were great! I checked the reviews before we left and was a bit worried about the mattresses and soon found that we had every right to be - the bed just wasn't comfortable with either the mattresses (springs digging into our backs) or just having one pillow each. We stayed in a double room - the kitchen was great and was a lot of the reason we wanted an apartment so we could buy some food from the supermarket and eat there rather than spending money out on every meal which worked out really well. The apartment was very small but to be honest we were only there to sleep and have breakfast so we didn't care. It was very clean, but extremely warm and we had to leave the window open all the time which was annoying at night when there were loud people outside. The location of these apartments was FANTASTIC - there are two tube stations within a minutes walking distance and Paddington Station is only 5 mins away by cab. There are heaps of shops, including a shopping mall, a number of pubs and 2 x Tescos stores all only a minute walk away which was great. We left our bags at the apartments on the morning we checked out at a cost of 5 pounds, we thought it was a small price to pay to not have to lug our cases around all day as our flight wasn't until 2230 that night. All in all - it was a great place to stay, the staff were very friendly and the location was really top notch. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “non executive”
Reviews.Author: 4weelbeel
Reviews.Content: as a man of 60 years and travelled to 45 different countries this is the worst bed I have ever slept in!!! too short too narrow,( along with my wife), put a sheet on the floor now lay on it, that's more comfortable. Don't ask for another pillow! we asked three times...no chance. The staff smile and say , yes, yes but nothing happens, they can't handle it, under staffed.( and do they care?). No place to hang up the wet towels. Executive standard now equals economy class.

Reviews.Title: “God awful beds!”
Reviews.Author: kizzyfergie
Reviews.Content: Yes, this place is clean and looks modern and inviting, but the beds, my god!! I am only 5ft 4 and my feet were touching the bottom of the bed, so my poor husband at 6ft had no chance. We are not elephants, and each time we sat on the edge of the bed it sunk and cracked. The mattress was the worst I have ever experienced, neither my husband or i slept well at all and left pretty sharpish in the morning with aching backs! The room was a standard one so I was not expecting great luxury, and i wish hubby had read the reviews before booking - but I have stayed in far nicer london hotels, for cheaper with much better beds! The 4 star rating is clearly just based on the looks and the kitchen (which does not come well equiped as we found out one Â£5 corkscrew later!).

Reviews.Title: “Good - but...”
Reviews.Author: Ontaryo
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 days and I have to say that my room was very clean, very new and overall nice. Whenever there was a problem, the staff reacted quickly. We blew a fuse one evening and all lights in our room weren't working anymore. Within 5 minutes the receptionist was at my door and helped with the problem. The hotel's location is flawless though - you have easy access to 3 different tube-lines, which connects you perfectly to most parts of the city. It's only 50m until Hyde Park so when the weather is fine this is an added bonus as well. So basically they tried well, however there were some problems. One for instance is the fact that all rooms facing the street were very noisy due to the fact that the windows were old and not isolated at all which resulted in me waking up at 6 am the very first morning. When I tried to go back to sleep though the room next to ours was cleaned and what can I say...? I have never heard someone cleaning a room that loudly!!! They were even vacuuming - at 6:45 am!!! Given the paper thin walls I felt like they were in my room instead... There are a few things which might be done better. As we stayed at a similiar hotel in Sweden before I know that the hotel can indeed provide dishwashing liquid when they expect you to wash up everything by yourself. We were only able to do so with warm water unfortunately. Charging 6 Pounds per day for internet access is a little heavy, too given the fact that other hotels provide it for free. WLAN isn't available in the rooms unfortunately, though at the recption there is an area where you can access the hotel's WLAN-network. Overall I would recommend the hotel but would try to get an apartment facing the courtyard. Overall our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Not much of a complainer...loved the eye candy...”
Reviews.Author: thespottedtoad
Reviews.Content: Most amazingly down to earth friendly staff. Stayed for 1 week; never slept in the beds once...but I know they've since been replaced. The location is awesome...and honestly I don't know which posh hotels everyone's been staying at for this price...as if people! come on?! You all have high expectations for your comparatively low outlay of $$$. It's CLEAN. SO CLEAN. Does anything else matter? Oddly, I encountered several strangers during my stay. I wasn't afraid of any of them. The interesting thing is if you actually look at someone and are friendly you may just make a friend for life. What a concept... Get out of your box people! Accept what you can afford and move on. And quit yelling at the staff. Nothing makes you look more like an idiot...

Reviews.Title: “Never a 4* Apartment, Noisy location, thin walls, Cheap/Poor Beds”
Reviews.Author: 1poser1
Reviews.Content: Great location, tube, shops etc close by, but these apartments could be soooo much better, but they obviously chose to go down the old Ikea furniture route, the bed was half the thickness of a normal matress located in a built in wooden frame, very uncomfortable. The room was very noisy - be prepared to be wakened at every toilet flush or kettle boiling in nearby rooms, only plasterboard walls separate each of the small refurbished rooms. They also charge Â£5 just for storing any luggage for a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “I wouldn't recommend Hyde Park Executive apartements because ...”
Reviews.Author: sarita555
Reviews.Content: Poorly equipped room, cheap mattress, not very clean - and our room was supposed to be one of the better ones - definitely not the advertised four stars. But Friendly staff , close to tube, park and shops.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: mahooy115
Reviews.Content: Hi there, everyone who says this hotel was crap!! it is not true, ive stayed in the most expensive hotels in london, okay the bed was not that much! but still the place was modern and PERFECT PRICE for a weekend hotel.. PEOPLE! you pay this much wat do you expect???!!!! ITS LONDON!!! u wont get a perfect place!! if you want to pay for a nice bed to sleep on! then go to cumberland, marriot, or any of those! luvvvdddddddddddddddd the place i recomend it for a stay 1 to 3 days :)

Reviews.Title: “Such potential”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneOyster
Reviews.Content: We booked this apartment for a weekend stay in London because of its location and price. I wished that I had read the reviews prior to booking. We agree with many of the reviewers that this property has great potential. It's in a great location, it's clean, has laundry facilities, is affordable and is suitable for many categories of travellers. All of the effort put into the refurbishment of this property was wasted for the sake of those cheap matresses. After a couple of sleepless and uncomfortable nights on that bed we decided that we would warn others and maybe inform the owners that travellers expect a basic level of comfort - a foam matress would have been better.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but NOT Executive. Worst bed ever!”
Reviews.Author: contentas
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the start of December. The room was much smaller than we expected but was clean, bright with everything you need EXCEPT a safe, a hair dryer, good duvet and only 2 pillows for a double bed. It had thee worst bed I have ever slept in - incredibly thin with springs sticking into us all night! Hotel smelled of cigarette smoke. Service was friendly. Good bathroom and shower. Noisy building late into the night. This place is ok if you just need a crash pad and can handle sleeping on a cheap thin mattress. Queensway tube station is a couple of minutes walk away. But to sum up, they really are taking the mick calling it "executive".

Reviews.Title: “Shoe box with a hob”
Reviews.Author: big_hungry_baboon
Reviews.Content: There is nothing luxury about this place. The staff are rude and infelxible and couldn't even get a phone message to us. The matress was so thin I laid awake at night counting the springs that were cutting into my vital organs. The shower was so small I had to step out of it to wash and then get back in to rinse. The kitchen had nothing you could really cook with, doing 2 packs of pasta from Tesco was a challenge. We booked here because we were returning from a long trip and wanted to stay in and cook for ourselves; what a mistake! We ended up spending even more eating out. Finally I should mention our window looked out over the ugliest block of flats I have ever seen which bloked out all natural light and the room was so hot and airless we ended up thinking London in midwinter was hotter than India. We have booked with lastmiute before and can highly recommend either of their Â£70ish secret hotels in Kensington. In fact, sleeping on a bench round the corner in Hyde Park would be better than this awful place!

Reviews.Title: “The worse beds ever!”
Reviews.Author: Monicatje
Reviews.Content: Great location and beautiful clean and well-equipped appartment but REALLY appaling bed. It was short ( wouldn't be able to accomodate someone over about 5 ft 10 tall) and lumpy with springs sticking out from it. It was like they had spent so much money on kitting out the appartment but then got the matresses out of a skip. So becuase of that we wouldn't come back. At the end of the day you're buying a bed and if you can't sleep properly then it's not good value for money. Also no bedside lighting at all - you had to have bright ceiling lights on if you wanted to read - not very relaxing. We stayed in Room B03 - avoid if you want a decent night's sleep.

HotelInfo.Name: Hyde Park Executive Apartments Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 8-18 Inverness Terrace, London W2 3HU, England
